1096376_14_ITEM15_P150_S0	The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
1096376_14_ITEM15_P151_S0	Exhibit 32.2 Statement of Chief Financial Officer Pursuant to Section 1350 of Title 18 of the United States Code Pursuant to Section 1350 of Title 18 of the United States Code as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the undersigned, Michael P. Monahan, the Chief Financial Officer of Nutrisystem, Inc. (the Company ), hereby certifies that based on the undersigned s knowledge:
1096376_14_ITEM15_P152_S0	The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P0_S0	Nutrisystem, Inc. (together with its consolidated subsidiaries, Nutrisystem, the Company, we, us, or our ) is a provider of weight management products and services, including nutritionally balanced weight loss programs, multi-day kits available at retail locations and digital tools to support weight loss.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P0_S1	Typically, our program customers purchase monthly food packages containing a 28-day supply of breakfasts, lunches, dinners, snacks and desserts, which they supplement with fresh fruits, vegetables and dairy.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P0_S2	Most of our customers order on an auto-delivery basis ( Auto-Delivery ), where we send a 28-day food supply on an ongoing basis until notified of a customer s cancellation.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P0_S3	We offer our pre-selected favorites food pack or personalized plans where customers can hand pick their entire menu or customize plans to their dietary preference.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P0_S4	Our meal plans feature more than 150 menu options at different price points including frozen and ready-to-go entrees, desserts, snacks and shakes.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P0_S5	Additionally, we offer comprehensive individualized counseling options from trained weight loss counselors, registered dietitians and certified diabetes educators and provide further support through our digital tools.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P0_S6	Our program is based on the following cornerstones that represent who we are to our customers:
1096376_15_ITEM1_P1_S0	The Nutrisystem program has helped millions of people lose weight successfully over our 40-plus year history.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P1_S1	Our program is portioned for weight loss and is nutritionally balanced to meet national dietary guidelines.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P1_S2	We also offer transition and maintenance plans, which include personalized menu options selected by our customer (e.g., only dinner entrees) as well as continued counseling support and access to Nutrisystem s digital tools.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P1_S3	These plans are designed to help our customers keep the weight off.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P2_S0	The Nutrisystem program is based on more than 40 years of nutrition research and the science of the low Glycemic Index, and offers portion-controlled items that include relatively higher amounts of fiber, contain good carbohydrates and zero trans fats.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P3_S0	The Glycemic Index is a measure of the quality of carbohydrates in foods.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P3_S1	Foods on the lower end of the Glycemic Index are generally considered good carbohydrates.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P3_S2	In addition, as of May 2014, we removed artificial flavors and sweeteners from all breakfasts, lunches, dessert bars and bakery items.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P4_S0	Nutrisystem sells its weight management program primarily through a direct-to-consumer sales and distribution approach using the Internet and telephone.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P4_S1	Our customers can place orders 24 hours a day, seven days a week on our website, www.nutrisystem.com , and the food is shipped directly to our customers doors.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P4_S2	Our customers can either choose our pre-selected favorites food pack or personalize their monthly food orders for their specific tastes or dietary needs.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P4_S3	Our program does not require customers to visit centers, measure foods or count calories.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P4_S4	The entrees are individually packaged and food preparation time is minimal.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P5_S0	The direct-to-consumer approach using the Internet and telephone provides the convenience and privacy that our customers value.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P5_S1	In addition, we provide online and telephone counseling and support to our customers using trained weight loss counselors, registered dietitians and other nutrition and dietary staff, and as a result, our customers do not need to travel for a face-to-face meeting.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P6_S0	We believe we are very competitively priced within the weight management industry and provide a compelling value proposition to our customers which includes a selection of more than 150 food items, expert guides, tools, including NuMi, our digital product that integrates with wearable fitness devices and health platforms, and access to trained weight loss counselors, registered dietitians and other nutrition and dietary staff.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P6_S1	We do not charge membership fees.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P6_S2	Various promotional offers and pricing are offered throughout the year.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P7_S0	Competitive Strengths We believe our program, kits and digital tools offer consumers a sensible approach to losing weight without the use of faddish, unhealthy or unrealistic weight loss methods by educating them about proper portion size, as well as the appropriate combinations of fiber, protein, good carbohydrates and fat.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P7_S1	We intend to capitalize on the following competitive strengths:
1096376_15_ITEM1_P8_S0	We believe most of our customers are very satisfied with our products and believe they have lost weight while using our program.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P8_S1	Our customer research has found that customers lost an average of 1.0 to 2.0 pounds per week and tended to stay on the program for 11 to 12 weeks.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P8_S2	Our research indicates overall satisfaction with our program and a potential willingness on the part of our customers to refer the Nutrisystem program to others.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P8_S3	We have also sponsored clinical trials at leading academic centers in patients with Type 2 diabetes.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P8_S4	Statistically significant and clinically meaningful weight loss and improvements in HbA1c (a key measure of blood glucose control) were observed, in addition to improvements in secondary endpoints such as waist circumference, total plasma cholesterol and blood pressure.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P9_S0	We believe that our brand is well recognized in the weight management industry.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P9_S1	Our company and our predecessors have been in the weight management industry for more than 40 years, and we estimate that our company and our predecessors have spent hundreds of millions of dollars in advertising over that time period.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P10_S0	Low Cost, Highly Scalable Model .
1096376_15_ITEM1_P11_S0	Unlike traditional commercial weight loss programs, which primarily sell through franchisee and company-owned centers, we generate revenue in our direct channel through the Internet and telephone (including the redemption of prepaid program cards).
1096376_15_ITEM1_P11_S1	Our method of distribution removes the fixed costs and capital investment associated with diet centers.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P11_S2	We also minimize fixed costs and capital investments in food procurement and fulfillment: we outsource the production of our food products to a number of vendors and we outsource 100% of our fulfillment operations to a third-party provider.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P12_S0	We also generate revenue through the sale of our products and kits at retail locations.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P12_S1	These products and kits represent a significant departure from our traditional 28-day program and have expanded our products and consumer reach.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P12_S2	The retail channel provides us with great brand exposure, offering consumers who may not be aware of our program an opportunity to sample Nutrisystem at an attractive price point.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P13_S0	Our goal is to offer our customers a complete weight management program that is convenient, private and cost-effective.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P13_S1	Our customers primarily place their orders through the Internet or over the telephone and have their food delivered directly to their homes.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P13_S2	This affords our customers the convenience and anonymity that other diets, which rely on weight-loss centers, cannot ensure.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P13_S3	Additionally, we provide our customers with a package of food, including daily breakfast, lunch, dinner and dessert, which removes the confusion of reading nutrition labels, measuring portions or counting calories, carbohydrates or points.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P13_S4	We believe our weight management program offers our customers significant value and is priced below those of our competitors.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P13_S5	In addition, we do not charge a membership fee, as opposed to many of our competitors.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P14_S0	Our Industry Weight management is a challenge for a significant portion of the U.S., as well as the global population.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P15_S0	The World Health Organization has stated that worldwide obesity has more than doubled since 1980 and estimated that in 2014, more than 1.9 billion adults, 18 years and older, were overweight and over 600 million of these were obese.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P16_S0	However, there is evidence that weight loss may reduce the risk of developing these conditions, as well as improve the health and quality of life of people who have these conditions.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P16_S1	Our clinical trial results suggest and analyses of real world customer results confirm that people who stay on the Nutrisystem program for at least three months have a high probability of achieving clinically meaningful weight loss.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P17_S0	In addition to the health risks, there are also cultural implications for those who are overweight or obese.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P17_S1	U.S. consumers are inundated with imagery in media, fashion and entertainment that depicts the thin body as the ideal body type.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P18_S0	Studies suggest that there is rampant discrimination against people with obesity.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P18_S1	Despite the high percentage of overweight and obese individuals in the U.S., the popularity of dieting appears to indicate consumers desire to be thin.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P19_S0	The weight loss industry is very competitive and consists of pharmaceutical products and weight loss programs, digital tools and wearable trackers, as well as a wide variety of diet foods and meal replacement bars and shakes, appetite suppressants and nutritional supplements.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P19_S1	The weight loss market is served by a diverse array of competitors.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P19_S2	Potential customers seeking to manage their weight can turn to traditional center-based competitors, online diet-oriented sites, self-directed dieting and self-administered products such as prescription drugs, over-the-counter drugs and supplements, as well as medically supervised programs.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P19_S3	Our identified peers and competitors include, but are not limited to, Atkins Nutritionals, Inc., eDiets.com, Jenny Craig, Medifast, Inc. and Weight Watchers International, Inc.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P19_S4	We believe that the principal competitive factors in the weight loss market are:
1096376_15_ITEM1_P20_S0	the ability to attract and retain customers through promotion and personal referral.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P20_S1	Based on these factors, we believe that we can compete effectively in the weight loss industry.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P20_S2	We, however, have no control over how successful competitors will be in addressing these factors.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P20_S3	By providing a well-recognized food-based weight management program using the direct channel, we believe that we have a competitive advantage in our market.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P20_S4	Our Products and Services For more than 40 years, the Nutrisystem name has been recognized as a leader in the weight loss industry.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P20_S5	We provide a comprehensive weight management program, consisting primarily of a pre-packaged food program, digital tools and counseling.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P21_S0	Typically, our customers purchase monthly food packages of frozen and ready-to-go food containing 28 days of breakfasts, lunches, dinners, snacks and desserts, which they supplement with fresh fruits, vegetables and dairy.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P21_S1	Most customers order through our Auto-Delivery feature.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P21_S2	Trained counselors are available to answer questions and make recommendations to help each customer achieve and maintain his or her weight loss goal.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P21_S3	Customers support and encourage each other and share information online and via Nutrisystem social media channels.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P21_S4	These services are complemented with relevant information on diet, nutrition and physical activity, including a personalized My Daily 3 physical activity program and expert guides with tips to help customers succeed on the program.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P21_S5	Additionally, NuMi, our digital product that integrates with wearable fitness devices and health platforms, is offered to our customers free of charge.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P22_S0	Our Nutrisystem program consists of more than 150 portion-controlled items that serve as the foundation of a low Glycemic Index diet.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P23_S0	protein and fat that meets national dietary guidelines.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P23_S1	We have also worked to reduce the sodium content of our meal program.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P23_S2	Including grocery additions to supplement our meals, our plans contain 1800-2200 milligrams of sodium per day, consistent with national guidelines, and tailored versions of the plans are available that deliver as low as 1500 mg/day.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P23_S3	In contrast, the average American consumes 2800-4000 milligrams of sodium per day.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P23_S4	In addition, as of May 2014, we removed artificial flavors and sweeteners from all breakfasts, lunches, dessert bars and bakery items.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P24_S0	We constantly strive to meet or exceed nutritional guidelines as they are updated.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P24_S1	We offer a customizable program, along with our Fast 5+ kit, a one-week starter kit that can help customers lose five pounds plus one inch off of their waist in their first week of dieting.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P25_S0	A large and growing body of scientific evidence suggests a key predictor of long-term weight loss success is quick, early results, which Fast 5+ is designed to deliver.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P26_S0	Fast 5+ includes seven days of breakfasts, lunches, and dinners, plus all-new shakes with formulations for men and women to meet their unique nutritional needs.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P26_S1	As part of our program, customers are given a meal plan and exercise suggestions and are encouraged to check in periodically with a Nutrisystem counselor as their needs change in response to weight loss.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P26_S2	Our program delivers a combination of portion-controlled foods and an eating plan based on slow digesting carbohydrates and fiber, designed to help keep blood sugar levels stable throughout the day, minimizing hunger spikes and the feelings of deprivation that cause cravings.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P26_S3	Additionally, Nutrisystem s 5-day Weight Loss Kits are available at select retailers and represent a significant departure from our traditional 28-day program.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P26_S4	We offer a core 5-day kit, a D kit targeted to individuals with or at risk of Type 2 diabetes, as well as SmartCarb and PowerFuel products including blueberry muffins, cinnamon buns, vanilla shakes, chocolate shakes and chocolate chip cookie packs, designed to complement the D kit.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P26_S5	The retail channel provides us with great brand exposure, offering consumers who may not be aware of our program an opportunity to sample Nutrisystem at an attractive price point.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P26_S6	We are seeing repeat business as well as multiple kit purchases, indicating that customers are seeing results or enlisting other family members to diet with them.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P26_S7	Also, we continue to offer our program at Costco through the use of prepaid program cards and gift cards.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P26_S8	We are actively developing our retail product pipeline and we expect to have additional products/kits to launch in retail.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P27_S0	The Nutrisystem D Program is a weight loss program specifically designed to produce gradual weight loss in overweight persons with, or at risk for, Type 2 diabetes.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P27_S1	It provides nutrition consistent with the guidelines of the American Diabetes Association.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P28_S0	Two randomized controlled trials published in peer-reviewed medical journals found the Nutrisystem D program, in combination with counseling sessions, produced statistically and clinically meaningful improvements in weight, HbA1c (a key measure of blood glucose control), and several other risk factors.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P28_S1	Notably, improvements in diabetes control were observed despite a reduction in diabetes medications among participants who received the Nutrisystem D intervention.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P28_S2	A third study, utilizing continuous glucose monitoring technology, found improvements in blood glucose control when subjects used the Nutrisystem D program, even before the achievement of significant weight loss.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P29_S0	By offering a variety of frozen and ready-to-go foods, we help our customers sustain their weight loss efforts.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P29_S1	On our website, customers can order food 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P29_S2	The transition and maintenance plans allow customers the means to gradually increase their responsibility for grocery shopping and food preparation while adhering to the principles of the Nutrisystem approach.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P29_S3	These lower cost programs help extend the supportive relationship and allow time to reinforce the dietary changes that produced the initial weight loss.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P29_S4	These plans include recipes and portion-control tools in addition to a reduced number of Nutrisystem entrees delivered each month.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P30_S0	The features of our weight loss program address many of the most common limitations of traditional weight loss programs, including high initiation and recurring membership fees, the inconvenience of traveling to weight loss centers for scheduled appointments and lack of privacy.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P30_S1	In addition, our prepared meals provide our customers with a structured program with limited weighing and measuring of foods and no need to count calories, carbohydrates or points.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P30_S2	We believe that the convenience of home delivery, reduced grocery shopping time, the portability of the food, and rapid food preparation also aid customer compliance with our weight loss program.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P31_S0	Our food items have accounted for 99% of our revenue for each of the years ended December 31, 2014, 2013 and 2012.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P31_S1	No other product or service has accounted for more than 1% of our revenue in any of the last three years.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P31_S2	In the years ended December 31, 2014, 2013 and 2012, approximately 99%, 99% and 98%, respectively, of our revenue were generated in the United States.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P32_S0	The Customer Experience Our sales, marketing, ecommerce and service operations seek to understand our customers needs throughout their weight loss and management journey to help us develop effective, compelling and innovative products and services.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P32_S1	Through a combination of consumer research and data management, we personalize the introduction, on-boarding, weight loss, transition and maintenance phases of our customers experience.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P33_S0	Introduction/Acquisition We attract new customers via direct response television, online marketing (search engine marketing, search engine optimization, affiliate marketing, display advertising, partnerships, retargeting and email), direct mail, print advertisements and a variety of other direct marketing efforts.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P33_S1	We have a fully integrated acquisition enterprise.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P33_S2	Response is tracked to the specific vehicle, and analytic models are used to attribute other orders back to the response source, in order to closely manage the effectiveness of our specific direct marketing efforts.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P34_S0	The majority of our new customers buy via our website.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P34_S1	We consistently seek to refine our sales conversion funnel through thoughtful testing to improve the learning and buying experience for prospects and to increase conversion rates.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P34_S2	We also have an in-house call center.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P34_S3	Staffing levels fluctuate seasonally and are aligned to marketing spend and consequent call volume.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P34_S4	Sales agents, paid primarily on commission, take in-bound responses from our advertisements, and personalize the weight loss plan for each customer.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P34_S5	They also make out-bound calls to our leads.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P35_S0	On-Boarding To help customers get off to a strong, successful and simple start, we provide both printed materials in initial shipments of food (including a My Way Made Easy magazine, Expert Guides, a Quick-Start guide, a Grocery Guide, a Dining Out booklet and a Daily Food Tracker) and a robust set of personalized online tools and trackers.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P35_S1	Customers are encouraged to join our large online community of customers past and present and we are active in social media to engage in conversations with our customers.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P36_S0	On-Program We use customer preferences to offer a variety of additional products and services that help customers while on the path to their weight loss goals.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P36_S1	These offers are made via our website, emails and newsletters, and our call center.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P36_S2	We also offer complementary counseling services for our customers with trained weight loss counselors, registered dietitians and certified diabetes educators.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P36_S3	We seek to hire counselors with backgrounds in psychology, sociology, nutrition, dietetics or other health-related fields and with suitable, compassionate personalities to help and support our customers throughout their weight loss journey.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P36_S4	Counselors are trained in our programs, motivational techniques and problem solving.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P36_S5	Counselors take in-bound requests for help and also reach out to customers via email and phone.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P37_S0	Transition and Maintenance As customers reach their weight loss goals, we offer transition and maintenance programs that provide products and guidance that combine the right amount of structure and flexibility.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P37_S1	These programs are offered online, via email marketing, and via our call center s retention agents.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P38_S0	We attract past customers primarily via our advertising vehicles, targeted emails, and data-driven direct mail attempts.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P39_S0	Customer Service We are committed to the highest levels of customer service and manage our customer relations through our in-house call center.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P39_S1	Our representatives are trained to answer questions and solve problems once a purchase has been made.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P39_S2	Customers contact us via email and phone.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P39_S3	Typical inquiries concern delivery dates, reported missing or damaged items, and requests for credits or exchanges.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P40_S0	For email inquiries, we have a software system that scans the customer s email for key words and automatically supplies the representative with a response that is then reviewed, edited, and sent to the customer.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P40_S1	We regularly review customer satisfaction levels and improve our practices accordingly.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P40_S2	We conduct a proactive public relations program that is designed to garner positive coverage of Nutrisystem and our weight management programs across all media platforms including television, magazine, print, online news, bloggers and social media, particularly around the key dieting seasons.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P40_S3	In addition, the public relations team supports an executive communication program to broadly support the Nutrisystem brand.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S0	An integrated order receipt, billing, picking, shipping and delivery tracking system comprised of proprietary and third-party components is utilized for our orders.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S1	This system integrates the front end, or website customer interface, with order processing and shipping, and allows customers to access shippers order tracking numbers online.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S2	Our computer-assisted picking system allows for virtually paperless order picking in all warehouse facilities.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S3	We utilize an integrated network of distribution facilities through an existing arrangement with our outside fulfillment provider.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S4	We work closely with our fulfillment provider to drive out waste and continuously improve processes.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S5	We currently utilize five outsourced distribution facilities.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S6	Three are located in Pennsylvania (Allentown, Bethlehem and Chambersburg) and two in Nevada (both in Sparks).
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S7	As of December 31, 2014, all fulfillment was being handled by one outsourced provider.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S8	We have a service agreement with our outside fulfillment provider which provides for storage, handling of frozen and ready-to-go foods and other services, including pricing and minimum space commitments.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S9	The current contract expires in 2020 but may be terminated sooner upon 180 days written notice.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S10	We believe that other outside fulfillment providers could be utilized if needed and we continually evaluate the need for secondary fulfillment services.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S11	We continue to partner with our fulfillment provider to reduce the warehouse order turn-around time for processing and shipping orders.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P41_S12	In 2014, approximately, 98% of all customer initial orders were shipped within three business days of the date the order was received.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P42_S0	Direct customers are not charged for their orders until the ordered product is shipped.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P42_S1	We do not charge customers for shipping and handling on Auto-Delivery food orders provided customers take receipt of their second order.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P42_S2	If a customer cancels before receipt of a second order, the customer will be charged for shipping and the difference in pricing for an Auto-Delivery order versus a non Auto-Delivery order.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P43_S0	All of our foods and supplements are currently outsourced from more than 30 manufacturers or vendors.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P43_S1	We have entered into supply agreements with some of these food vendors.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P44_S0	annual pricing, annual purchase obligations, as well as exclusivity in the production of certain products, with terms of five years or less.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P44_S1	One agreement also provides for certain rebates to us if certain volume thresholds are exceeded.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P44_S2	These contracts may be terminated by us upon written notice, generally between 30 and 180 days, or under certain circumstances only upon a default of the vendor.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P44_S3	We anticipate meeting all annual purchase obligations.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P44_S4	In 2014, approximately 17% and 14%, respectively, of inventory purchases were from two vendors.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P44_S5	We have supply agreements with these vendors that require us to make certain minimum purchases.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P44_S6	In 2013, these vendors supplied approximately 14% and 12%, respectively, of inventory purchases and in 2012, approximately 17% and 13%, respectively, of inventory purchases.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P45_S0	Our product development team uses a number of sources customer feedback, market trends, nutrition science, national dietary guidelines and breakthroughs in food technology to create new ideas for our program.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P45_S1	New foods are created to enhance the variety of our current offerings or to support the efforts of creating a new program.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P45_S2	Typically, concepts are formulated in collaboration with our food manufacturers to meet our requirements for nutrition and stability.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P45_S3	We then contract with these food manufacturers to produce these products based on our specifications.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P46_S0	Alternatively, food manufacturers may suggest items.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P46_S1	Regardless of a given food item s pathway through development, that food is evaluated for nutrition, compliance with our program, taste, and cost considerations.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P47_S0	The number of stock keeping units, or SKUs, we introduce each year varies depending on whether we are introducing a new program or simply updating an existing one.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P48_S0	Our Customers We offer weight loss programs designed for women, men, seniors as well as people with Type 2 diabetes who want to lose weight.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P48_S1	Based on our customer research, our typical customer is female, approximately 52 years of age.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P48_S2	We believe that, on average, our customers want to lose approximately 44 pounds over a period of time.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P48_S3	Additionally, based on our customer research, we believe our typical customers tend to stay on our program for 11 to 12 weeks, lose 1.0 to 2.0 pounds per week and have tried other popular diet programs.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P48_S4	We believe that this research indicates a willingness to refer our program to others and that our customers value the following Nutrisystem program attributes:
1096376_15_ITEM1_P49_S0	they do not feel hungry while on the program.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P50_S0	Our ecommerce and community websites and our tools and trackers, all of which are based primarily on third-party software customized to meet our business needs, are each hosted in top tier hosting facilities.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P50_S1	These facilities provide redundant network connections, physical and fire security and diesel generated power back up for the equipment upon which our websites rely and are intended to provide an uninterruptible power supply.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P50_S2	Our servers and our network are monitored 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P50_S3	We use a variety of security techniques to protect our confidential customer data.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P50_S4	When our customers place an order or access their account information, we secure that transaction by using some of the best available encryption technologies, including secure sockets layer, or SSL.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P50_S5	Our customer data is protected against unauthorized access by security measures and we engage a variety of industry leading technology providers including VeriSign, CyberSource and SecureWorks to further ensure the security of our credit card transactions and the safety of our customers personal information.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P51_S0	Intellectual Property We own numerous domestic and international trademarks and other proprietary rights that are important to our business.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P52_S0	Depending upon the jurisdiction, trademarks are valid as long as they are used in the regular course of trade and/or their registrations are properly maintained.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P53_S0	We believe the protection of our trademarks, copyrights, patents, domain names, trade dress, and trade secrets are important to our success.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P53_S1	We aggressively protect our intellectual property rights by relying on a combination of watch services and trademark, copyright, patent, trade dress and trade secret laws, and through the domain name dispute resolution system.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P53_S2	Employees As of December 31, 2014, we had 417 employees and consider our relations with these employees to be good.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P54_S0	Typically in the weight loss industry, revenue is greatest in the first calendar quarter and lowest in the fourth quarter.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P55_S0	We believe our business experiences seasonality, driven primarily by the predisposition of dieters to initiate a diet at certain times of the year and the placement of our advertising, which is based on the price and availability of certain media at such times.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P56_S0	Available Information All periodic and current reports, registration statements, code of conduct and other material that we are required to file with the SEC, including our annual report on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form10-Q, current reports on Form 8-K, and amendments to those reports filed or furnished pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act ), are available free of charge through our investor relations page at www.nutrisystem.com .
1096376_15_ITEM1_P56_S1	Such documents are available as soon as reasonably practicable after electronic filing of the material with the SEC.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P56_S2	Our Internet website and the information contained therein or connected thereto are not intended to be incorporated into this Annual Report.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P56_S3	The public may also read and copy any materials filed by the Company with the SEC at the SEC s Public Reference Room at 100 F Street, NE, Washington, DC 20549.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P56_S4	The public may obtain information on the operation of the Public Reference Room by calling the SEC at 1-800-SEC-0330.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P56_S5	The SEC maintains an Internet site, www.sec.gov , which contains reports, proxy and information statements, and other information regarding issuers that file such information electronically with the SEC.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P57_S0	Executive Officers of the Company The Company s current executive officers and their respective ages and positions are as follows:
1096376_15_ITEM1_P58_S0	Executive Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer Dawn M. Zier has served as our President and Chief Executive Officer and as a member of our Board of Directors since November 2012.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P58_S1	Before joining us, Ms. Zier served as the President of International at RDA Holding Co., the holding company and parent of The Reader s Digest Association, Inc., a global media and direct marketing company (the Reader s Digest Association ), since April 2011, as an Executive Vice President of the Reader s Digest Association since February 2011 and as President, Europe of the Reader s Digest Association since October 2009.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P58_S2	Prior to serving in these roles, Ms. Zier served as the President of Global Consumer Marketing for the Reader s Digest Association from June 2008 to October 2009 and as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Direct Holdings U.S. Corp., a marketer of audio and video products and at such time a subsidiary of the Reader s Digest Association, from June 2009 to October 2009.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P59_S0	From August 2005 to June 2008, Ms. Zier served as the President of North American Consumer Marketing for the Reader s Digest Association.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P59_S1	Michael P. Monahan has served as our Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer since May 2013.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P59_S2	Prior to joining us, Mr. Monahan served as the Chief Financial Officer of PetroChoice Holdings, Inc., a privately-held distributor of industrial, commercial and passenger car lubricants since January 2009.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P59_S3	From April 2006 through January 2009, Mr. Monahan served as our Vice President of Finance.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P59_S4	Prior to that, Mr. Monahan held positions with Exelon Corporation, Accenture and Arthur Andersen LLP.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P59_S5	Keira Krausz has served as our Executive Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer since February 2013.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P59_S6	Prior to joining us, Ms. Krausz served as head of new business development for Animated Storyboards, a global independent provider of television test spots to the advertising industry, from April 2012 to January 2013.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P59_S7	Prior to that, Ms. Krausz served as Vice President of Marketing for QSP, Inc., a subsidiary of Time, Inc. from 2005 until March 2012 as QSP was sold.
1096376_15_ITEM1_P60_S0	Ms. Krausz started her career at Reader s Digest Association in 1992, and held a number of progressively-responsible positions in product management, marketing, and business management, ultimately ascending to Vice President, Marketing and General Manager, of Reader s Digest Association s Books Music Business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P0_S0	carefully the following risks and uncertainties when reading this Annual Report.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P0_S1	If any of the events described below actually occurs, the Company s business, financial condition and operating results could be materially adversely affected.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P0_S2	You should understand that it is not possible to predict or identify all such risks and uncertainties.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P0_S3	Consequently, you should not consider the following to be a complete discussion of all potential risks or uncertainties.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P1_S0	Risks Related to Our Business Our future growth and profitability will depend in large part upon the effectiveness and efficiency of our marketing expenditures and our ability to select effective markets and media in which to advertise.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P1_S1	Our marketing expenditures were $107.7 million, $95.8 million and $111.1 million in 2014, 2013 and 2012, respectively.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P1_S2	Our future growth and profitability will depend in large part upon the effectiveness and efficiency of our marketing expenditures, including our ability to:
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P2_S0	convert consumer inquiries into actual orders.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P2_S1	Our planned marketing expenditures may not result in increased revenue or generate sufficient levels of brand name and program awareness.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P2_S2	We may not be able to manage our marketing expenditures on a cost-effective basis whereby our customer acquisition costs may exceed the contribution profit generated from each additional customer.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P2_S3	Our sales may be adversely impacted by the health and stability of the general economy.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P2_S4	Unfavorable changes in general economic conditions, such as a recession or prolonged economic slowdown, may reduce the demand for our products and otherwise adversely affect our sales.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P2_S5	For example, economic forces, including general economic conditions, demographic trends, consumer confidence in the economy, changes in disposable consumer income and/or reductions in discretionary spending, may cause consumers to defer purchases of our program which could adversely affect our revenue, gross margins, and/or our overall financial condition and operating results.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P2_S6	We rely on third parties to provide us with adequate food supply, freight and fulfillment and Internet and networking services, the loss of any of which could cause our revenue, earnings or reputation to suffer.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P2_S7	We rely solely on third-party manufacturers to supply all of the food and other products we sell.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P2_S8	In 2014, approximately 17% and 14%, respectively, of inventory purchases were from two vendors.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P3_S0	If we are unable to obtain sufficient quantity, quality and variety of food and other products in a timely and low-cost manner from our manufacturers, we will be unable to fulfill our customers orders in a timely manner, which may cause us to lose revenue and market share or incur higher costs, as well as damage the value of the Nutrisystem brand.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P4_S0	In 2014, more than 94% of our orders were shipped by one third-party provider and 100% of our order fulfillment was handled by one third-party provider.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P4_S1	Should these providers be unable to service our needs for even a short duration, our revenue and business could be harmed.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P4_S2	Additionally, the cost and time associated with replacing these providers on short notice would add to our costs.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P4_S3	Any replacement fulfillment provider would also require startup time, which could cause us to lose sales and market share.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P4_S4	Our business also depends on a number of third parties for Internet access and networking, and we have limited control over these third parties.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P4_S5	Should our network connections go down, our ability to fulfill orders would be delayed.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P4_S6	Further, if our website or call center become unavailable for a noticeable period of time due to Internet or communication failures, our business could be adversely affected, including harm to our brand and loss of sales.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P4_S7	Therefore, we are dependent on maintaining good relationships with these third parties.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P4_S8	The services we require from these parties may be disrupted by a number of factors associated with their businesses, including the following:
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S0	with respect to our food suppliers, shortages of ingredients or United States Department of Agriculture ( USDA ) or United States Food and Drug Administration ( FDA ) compliance issues.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S1	We may be subject to claims that our personnel are unqualified to provide proper weight loss advice.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S2	Some of our counselors for our weight management program do not have extensive training or certification in nutrition, diet or health fields and have only undergone the training they receive from us.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S3	We may be subject to claims from our customers alleging that our personnel lack the qualifications necessary to provide proper advice regarding weight loss and related topics.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S4	We may also be subject to claims that our personnel have provided inappropriate advice or have inappropriately referred or failed to refer customers to health care providers for matters other than weight loss.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S5	Such claims could result in lawsuits, damage to our reputation and divert management s attention from our business, which would adversely affect our business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S6	We may be subject to health or advertising related claims from our customers.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S7	Our weight loss program does not include medical treatment or medical advice, and we do not engage physicians or nurses to monitor the progress of our customers.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S8	Many people who are overweight suffer from other physical conditions, and our target consumers could be considered a high-risk population.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S9	A customer who experiences health problems could allege or bring a lawsuit against us on the basis that those problems were caused or worsened by participating in our weight management program.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S10	For example, our predecessor businesses suffered substantial losses due to health-related claims and related publicity.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S11	Further, customers who allege that they were deceived by any statements that we made in advertising or labeling could bring a lawsuit against us under consumer protection laws.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S12	Currently, we are neither subject to any such allegations nor have we been named in any such litigation.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S13	If we were subject to any such claims, while we would defend ourselves against such claims, we may ultimately be unsuccessful in our defense.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S14	Also, defending ourselves against such claims, regardless of their merit and ultimate outcome, would likely be lengthy and costly, and adversely affect our results of operations.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P5_S15	Further, our general liability insurance may not cover claims of these types.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P6_S0	The weight management industry is highly competitive.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P6_S1	If any of our competitors or a new entrant into the market with significant resources pursues a weight management program similar to ours, our business could be significantly affected.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P6_S2	Competition is intense in the weight management industry and we must remain competitive in the areas of program efficacy, price, taste, customer service and brand recognition.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P6_S3	Our competitors include companies selling pharmaceutical products and weight loss programs, digital tools and wearable trackers, as well as a wide variety of diet foods and meal replacement bars and shakes, appetite suppressants and nutritional supplements.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P6_S4	Some of our competitors are significantly larger than we are and have substantially greater resources.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P6_S5	Our business could be adversely affected if someone with significant resources decided to imitate our weight management program.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P6_S6	For example, if a major supplier of pre-packaged foods decided to enter this market and made a substantial investment of resources in advertising and training diet counselors, our business could be significantly affected.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P6_S7	Any increased competition from new entrants into our industry or any increased success by existing competition could result in reductions in our sales or prices, or both, which could have an adverse effect on our business and results of operations.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P7_S0	We are dependent on certain third-party agreements for a percentage of revenue.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P7_S1	We have contractual agreements with certain third-party retailers.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P7_S2	Under the agreements, these third parties control when and how often our products and services are offered and we are not guaranteed any minimum level of sales or transactions.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P7_S3	Additionally, some agreements contain exclusive rights in specified locations to promote our products during the contract term and for a specified period thereafter.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P7_S4	If any third party elects not to renew their agreement with us or reduces the promotion of our products, our revenue will suffer.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P7_S5	In addition, our third-party retailers may decide to stop selling our products upon written notice, which may result in an increased level of reclamation claims as inventory held by the retailer is depleted.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P7_S6	In the event any retailer terminates its relationship with us and the level of reclamation claims exceeds the estimated amount reserved on our balance sheet at the time of sale to the retailer, we will have to record an expense for the excess claims, which could adversely impact our results of operations and financial condition.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P7_S7	Additionally, in certain instances, we could be prohibited from selling our products through competitors of these third parties for a specified time after the termination of the agreements.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P8_S0	New weight loss products or services may put us at a competitive disadvantage.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P8_S1	On an ongoing basis, many existing and potential providers of weight loss solutions, including many pharmaceutical firms with significantly greater financial and operating resources than we have, are developing new products and services.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P8_S2	The creation of a weight loss solution, such as a drug therapy, that is perceived to be safe, effective and easier than a portion-controlled meal plan would put us at a disadvantage in the marketplace and our results of operations could be negatively affected.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P8_S3	We may be subject to litigation from our competitors.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P8_S4	Our competitors may pursue litigation against us based on our advertising or other marketing practices regardless of its merit and chances of success, especially if we engage in competitive advertising, which includes advertising that directly or indirectly mentions a competitor or a competitor s weight loss program in comparison to our program.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P8_S5	While we would defend ourselves against any such claims, our defense may ultimately be unsuccessful.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P8_S6	Also, defending against such claims, regardless of their merit and ultimate outcome, may be lengthy and costly, strain our resources and divert management s attention from their core responsibilities, which would have a negative impact on our business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P9_S0	Our business is subject to online security risks, including security breaches and identity theft.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P9_S1	Unauthorized users who penetrate our information security could misappropriate proprietary or customer information or data or cause interruptions to the product offerings on our website.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P10_S0	These expenditures, however, may not prove to be a timely remedy against unauthorized users who are able to penetrate our information security.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P10_S1	In addition to purposeful security breaches, the inadvertent transmission of computer viruses could adversely affect our computer systems and, in turn, harm our business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P11_S0	A significant number of states require that customers be notified if a security breach results in the disclosure of their personal financial account or other information.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P11_S1	Additional states and governmental entities are considering such notice laws.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P11_S2	In addition, other public disclosure laws may require that material security breaches be reported.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P11_S3	If we experience a security breach and such notice or public disclosure is required in the future, our reputation and our business may be harmed.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S0	In the ordinary course of our business, we collect and utilize proprietary and customer information and data.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S1	Privacy concerns among prospective and existing customers regarding our use of such information or data collected on our website or through our services and products, such as weight management information, financial data, email addresses and home addresses, could keep them from using our website or purchasing our services or products.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S2	We currently face certain legal obligations regarding the manner in which we treat such information and data.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S3	Businesses have been criticized by privacy groups and governmental bodies for their use and handling of such information and data.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S4	Currently, a significant number of our customers authorize us to bill their credit cards directly for fees charged by us.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S5	We rely on third-party software products to secure our credit card transactions.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S6	Although we have developed systems and processes that are designed to protect consumer information and prevent fraudulent payment transactions and other security breaches, failure to prevent or mitigate such fraud or breaches or changes in industry standards or regulations may adversely affect our business and operating results or cause us to lose our ability to accept credit cards as a form of payment and result in chargebacks of the fraudulently charged amounts.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S7	Furthermore, widespread credit card fraud may lessen our customers willingness to purchase our products on our website.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S8	We may experience fluctuations in our operating results which may cause our stock price to be volatile.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S9	We have experienced and expect to continue to experience fluctuations in our quarterly results of operations.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S10	Our business is seasonal, with revenue generally greatest in the first quarter and weaker in the fourth quarter.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S11	The market price of our common stock is subject to fluctuations in response to our operating results, general trends in the weight loss industry, announcements by our competitors, our ability to meet or exceed securities analysts expectations, recommendations by securities analysts, the condition of the financial markets and other factors.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S12	These fluctuations, as well as general economic and market conditions, may adversely affect the market price of our common stock and cause it to fluctuate significantly.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S13	Future acquisitions and the pursuit of new business opportunities present risks, and we may be unable to achieve the financial and strategic goals of any acquisition or new business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S14	A component of our growth strategy may be to acquire existing businesses or pursue other business opportunities in the market for weight management and fitness products and services.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P12_S15	Even if we succeed in acquiring or building such businesses, we will face a number of risks and uncertainties, including:
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P13_S0	the risk that the anticipated benefits of any acquisition or of the commencement of any new business may not be realized, in which event we will not be able to achieve any return on our investment in that new business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P13_S1	Consummating these transactions could also result in the incurrence of additional debt and related interest expense, as well as unforeseen contingent liabilities, all of which could have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition or results of operations.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P13_S2	We may also issue additional equity in connection with these transactions, which would dilute our existing stockholders.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P13_S3	If we do not continue to receive referrals from existing customers, our customer acquisition cost may increase.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P13_S4	We rely on word-of-mouth advertising for a portion of our new customers.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P13_S5	If our brand suffers or the number of customers acquired through referrals drops due to other circumstances, our costs associated with acquiring new customers and generating revenue will increase, which will, in turn, have an adverse affect on our profitability.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S0	We use third-party marketing vendors to promote our products.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S1	If the spokespersons affiliated with the third-party marketing vendors suffer adverse publicity, our revenue could be adversely affected.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S2	Our marketing strategy depends in part on celebrity spokespersons, as well as customer spokespersons, to promote our weight management program.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S3	Any of these spokespersons may become the subject of adverse news reports, negative publicity or otherwise be alienated from a segment of our customer base, whether weight loss related or not.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S4	If so, such events may reduce the effectiveness of his or her endorsement and, in turn, adversely affect our revenue and results of operations.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S5	Third parties may infringe on our brand, trademarks and other intellectual property rights, which may have an adverse impact on our business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S6	We currently rely on a combination of trademark and other intellectual property laws and confidentiality procedures to establish and protect our proprietary rights, including our brand.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S7	If we fail to successfully enforce our intellectual property rights, the value of our brand, services and products could be diminished and our business may suffer.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S8	Our precautions may not prevent misappropriation of our intellectual property.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S9	Any legal action that we may bring to protect our brand and other intellectual property could be unsuccessful and expensive and could divert management s attention from other business concerns.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S10	In addition, legal standards relating to the validity, enforceability and scope of protection of intellectual property, especially in Internet-related businesses, are uncertain and evolving.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S11	We cannot assure you that these evolving legal standards will sufficiently protect our intellectual property rights in the future.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S12	We may in the future be subject to intellectual property rights claims.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S13	Third parties may in the future make claims against us alleging infringement of their intellectual property rights.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P14_S14	Any intellectual property claims, regardless of merit, could be time-consuming and expensive to litigate or settle and could significantly divert management s attention from other business concerns.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S0	unable to successfully defend against such claims, we may have to pay damages, stop selling the service or product or stop using the software, technology or content found to be in violation of a third party s rights, seek a license for the infringing service, product, software, technology or content or develop alternative non-infringing services, products, software, technology or content.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S1	If we cannot license on reasonable terms, develop alternatives or stop using the service, product, software, technology or content for any infringing aspects of our business, we may be forced to limit our service and product offerings.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S2	Any of these results could reduce our revenue and our ability to compete effectively, increase our costs or harm our business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S3	Our credit agreement, as amended, contains financial and other covenants.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S4	The failure to comply with such covenants could have an adverse effect on us.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S5	Our credit agreement, as amended, contains certain financial and other covenants including a minimum consolidated fixed charge coverage ratio, a minimum consolidated tangible net worth and a minimum consolidated liquidity ratio, and includes limitations on, among other things, capital expenditures, additional indebtedness, acquisitions and restrictions on paying dividends in certain circumstances.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S6	Any failure to comply with the restrictions of the credit agreement, as amended, may result in an event of default under the agreement.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S7	We are dependent on our key executive officers for future success.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S8	If we lose the services of any of our key executive officers and we are unable to timely retain a qualified replacement, our business could be harmed.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S9	Our future success depends to a significant degree on the skills, experience and efforts of our key executive officers.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S10	The loss of the services of any of these individuals could harm our business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S11	We have not obtained life insurance on any key executive officers.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S12	If any key executive officers left us or were seriously injured and became unable to work, our business could be harmed.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S13	Provisions in our certificate of incorporation may deter or delay an acquisition of us or prevent a change in control, even if an acquisition or a change of control would be beneficial to our stockholders.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S14	Provisions of our certificate of incorporation (as amended) may have the effect of deterring unsolicited takeovers or delaying or preventing a third party from acquiring control of us, even if our stockholders might otherwise receive a premium for their shares over then current market prices.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P15_S15	In addition, these provisions may limit the ability of stockholders to approve transactions that they may deem to be in their best interests.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P16_S0	Our certificate of incorporation (as amended) permits our Board of Directors to issue preferred stock without stockholder approval upon such terms as the Board of Directors may determine.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P16_S1	The rights of the holders of our common stock will be junior to, and may be adversely affected by, the rights of the holders of any preferred stock that may be issued in the future.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P16_S2	The issuance of preferred stock could have the effect of making it more difficult for a third party to acquire, or of discouraging a third party from acquiring, a majority of our outstanding common stock.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P16_S3	The issuance of a substantial number of preferred shares could adversely affect the price of our common stock.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P16_S4	Risks Related to Our Industry Changes in consumer preferences could negatively impact our operating results.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P16_S5	Our program features pre-packaged food selections, which we believe offer convenience and value to our customers.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P16_S6	Our continued success depends, to a large degree, upon the continued popularity of our program versus various other weight loss, weight management and fitness regimens, such as low carbohydrate diets, appetite suppressants and diets featured in the published media.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P16_S7	Changes in consumer tastes and preferences away from our pre-packaged food and support and counseling services, and any failure to provide innovative responses to these changes, may have a materially adverse impact on our business, financial condition, operating results, cash flows and prospects.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P17_S0	Our success is also dependent on our food innovation including maintaining a robust array of food items and improving the quality of existing items.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P17_S1	If we do not continually expand our food items or provide customers with items that are desirable in taste and quality, our business could be harmed.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P17_S2	The weight loss industry is subject to adverse publicity, which could harm our business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P17_S3	The weight loss industry receives adverse publicity from time to time, and the occurrence of such publicity could harm us, even if the adverse publicity is not directly related to us.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P17_S4	In the early 1990s, our predecessor businesses were subject to extremely damaging adverse publicity relating to a large number of lawsuits alleging that the Nutrisystem weight loss program in use at that time led to gall bladder disease.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P17_S5	This publicity was a factor that contributed to the bankruptcy of our predecessor businesses in 1993.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P18_S0	More recently, our predecessor businesses were severely impacted by significant litigation and damaging publicity related to their customers use of fen-phen as an appetite suppressant, which the FDA ordered withdrawn from the market in September 1997.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P18_S1	The significant decline in business resulting from the fen-phen problems caused our predecessor businesses to close all of their company-owned weight loss centers.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P18_S2	Congressional hearings about practices in the weight loss industry have also resulted in adverse publicity and a consequent decline in the revenue of weight loss businesses.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P18_S3	Future research reports or publicity that is perceived as unfavorable or that question certain weight loss programs, products or methods could result in a decline in our revenue.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P18_S4	Because of our dependence on consumer perceptions, adverse publicity associated with illness or other undesirable effects resulting from the consumption of our products or similar products by competitors, whether or not accurate, could also damage customer confidence in our weight loss program and result in a decline in revenue.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P18_S5	Adverse publicity could arise even if the unfavorable effects associated with weight loss products or services resulted from the user s failure to use such products or services appropriately.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P19_S0	Our industry is subject to governmental regulation that could increase in severity and hurt results of operations.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P19_S1	Our industry is subject to federal, state and other governmental regulation.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P19_S2	Certain federal and state agencies, such as the Federal Trade Commission (the FTC ), regulate and enforce such laws relating to advertising, disclosures to consumers, privacy, consumer pricing and billing arrangements and other consumer protection matters.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P20_S0	A determination by a federal or state agency, or a court, that any of our practices do not meet existing or new laws or regulations could result in liability, adverse publicity, and restrictions of our business operations.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P21_S0	Some advertising practices in the weight loss industry have led to investigations from time to time by the FTC and other governmental agencies.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P21_S1	Many companies in the weight loss industry, including our predecessor businesses, have entered into consent decrees with the FTC relating to weight loss claims and other advertising practices.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P21_S2	In October 2009, the FTC published its revised Guides concerning the Use of Endorsements and Testimonials in Advertising which now requires us to use a statement as to what the typical weight loss a customer can expect to achieve on our program when using a customer s weight loss testimonial in advertising.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P22_S0	Federal and state regulation of advertising practices generally, and in the weight loss industry in particular, may increase in scope or severity in the future, which could have a material adverse impact on our business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P22_S1	Other aspects of our industry are also subject to government regulation.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P22_S2	For example, the labeling and distribution of food products, including dietary supplements, are subject to strict USDA and FDA requirements and food manufacturers are subject to rigorous inspection and other requirements of the USDA and FDA, and companies operating in foreign markets must comply with those countries requirements for proper labeling, controls on hygiene, food preparation and other matters.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P22_S3	If federal, state, local or foreign regulation of our industry increases for any reason, then we may be required to incur significant expenses, as well as modify our operations to comply with new regulatory requirements, which could harm our operating results.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P22_S4	Additionally, remedies available in any potential administrative or regulatory actions may include product recalls and requiring us to refund amounts paid by all affected customers or pay other damages, which could be substantial.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P23_S0	Laws and regulations directly applicable to communications, operations or commerce over the Internet such as those governing intellectual property, privacy, libel and taxation, are more prevalent and remain unsettled.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P23_S1	If we are required to comply with new laws or regulations or new interpretations of existing laws or regulations, or if we are unable to comply with these laws, regulations or interpretations, our business could be adversely affected.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P23_S2	Future laws or regulations, including laws or regulations affecting our marketing and advertising practices, relations with consumers, employees, service providers, or our services and products, may have an adverse impact on us.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P24_S0	The sale of ingested products involves product liability and other risks.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P24_S1	Like other distributors of products that are ingested, we face an inherent risk of exposure to product liability claims if the use of our products results in illness or injury.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P24_S2	The foods that we resell in the U.S. are subject to laws and regulations, including those administered by the USDA and FDA that establish manufacturing practices and quality standards for food products.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P24_S3	Product liability claims could have a material adverse effect on our business as existing insurance coverage may not be adequate.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P25_S0	Distributors of weight loss food products, including dietary supplements, as well as our predecessor businesses, have been named as defendants in product liability lawsuits from time to time.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P26_S0	The successful assertion or settlement of an uninsured claim, a significant number of insured claims or a claim exceeding the limits of our insurance coverage would harm us by adding costs to the business and by diverting the attention of senior management from the operation of the business.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P26_S1	We may also be subject to claims that our products contain contaminants, are improperly labeled, include inadequate instructions as to use or inadequate warnings covering interactions with other substances.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P26_S2	Product liability litigation, even if not meritorious, is very expensive and could also entail adverse publicity for us and reduce our revenue.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P26_S3	In addition, the products we distribute, or certain components of those products, may be subject to product recalls or other deficiencies.
1096376_15_ITEM1A_P26_S4	Any negative publicity associated with these actions would adversely affect our brand and may result in decreased product sales and, as a result, lower revenue and profits.
1096376_15_ITEM2_P0_S0	This location totals 119,767 square feet of office space and our lease expires in 2022.
1096376_15_ITEM2_P0_S1	We also had a lease in Hoboken, New Jersey which was 2,515 square feet of office space which ended in February 2015.
1096376_15_ITEM2_P0_S2	Our fulfillment capacity is located in Chambersburg, Pennsylvania, Allentown, Pennsylvania, Bethlehem, Pennsylvania and Sparks, Nevada through an outsourced provider.
1096376_15_ITEM2_P0_S3	We have no lease obligations to any of our outsourced fulfillment providers; however, we are subject to minimum space commitments which we may reduce over a specified period of time.
1096376_15_ITEM2_P0_S4	Management believes our outsourced fulfillment capacity is adequate to meet our needs for the foreseeable future.
1096376_15_ITEM3_P0_S0	The Company is involved in various claims and routine litigation matters.
1096376_15_ITEM3_P0_S1	In the opinion of management, after consultation with legal counsel, the outcomes of such matters are not anticipated to have a material adverse effect on the Company s consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows in future years.

1096376_15_ITEM5_P0_S2	As of February 27, 2015, the Company had approximately 234 record holders of its common stock.

1096376_15_ITEM5_P1_S1	We have paid a quarterly dividend of $0.175 per share beginning with the second quarter of 2008.
1096376_15_ITEM5_P1_S2	The declaration and payment of dividends in the future will be determined by our Board of Directors in light of conditions then existing, including our earnings, financial condition, capital requirements and other factors.
