Monahan, the Chief Financial Officer of Nutrisystem, Inc. (the Company ), hereby certifies that based on the undersigned s knowledge:
1096376_16_ITEM15_P159_S0	The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P0_S0	Overview Nutrisystem, Inc. (together with its consolidated subsidiaries, Nutrisystem, the Company, we, us, or our ) is a provider of weight management products and services, including nutritionally balanced weight loss programs sold primarily online and over the telephone, multi-day kits and single items available at select retail locations and digital tools to support weight loss.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P1_S0	Typically, our program customers purchase monthly food packages containing a four-week meal plan consisting of breakfasts, lunches, dinners, snacks and flex meal plan recipes, which they supplement with fresh fruits, vegetables, lean protein and low-fat dairy.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P1_S1	Most of our customers order on an auto-delivery basis ( Auto-Delivery ), which means we send a four-week meal plan on an ongoing basis until notified of a customer s cancellation.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P1_S2	Auto-Delivery customers are offered savings off of our regular one-time rate with each consecutive order.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P1_S3	Monthly notifications are also sent to remind customers to update order preferences.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P1_S4	We offer our pre-selected favorites food pack or personalized plans where customers can hand pick their entire menu or customize plans to their specific tastes or dietary preference.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P2_S0	Nutrisystem meal plans feature more than 150 menu options at different price points including frozen and ready-to-go entrees, snacks and shakes.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P2_S1	Additionally , we offer counseling options from our trained weight loss counselors, registered dietitians and certified diabetes educators, at no extra cost and are available as needed, seven days a week from 7am-midnight E.T., with further support provided through our digital tools.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P3_S0	Our programs are based on the following cornerstones that represent who we are to our customers:
1096376_17_ITEM1_P4_S0	Our programs have helped millions of people lose weight successfully over our 40-plus year history.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P4_S1	Our programs are nutritionally balanced and portioned for weight loss.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P4_S2	We also offer transition and maintenance plans, which include personalized menu options (e.g., only dinner entrees) as well as continued counseling support and access to NuMi by Nutrisystem.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P5_S0	NuMi is an easy-to-use, interactive and personalized weight loss tracking tool.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P5_S1	This digital product integrates with wearable fitness devices and health platforms and is available for free to Nutrisystem customers as well as the general population of do-it-yourself dieters.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P5_S2	These plans are designed to help our customers keep the weight off.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P6_S0	Nutrisystem programs are based on more than 40 years of nutrition research and the science of the low Glycemic Index, and offer portion-controlled items that include relatively higher amounts of fiber and contain good carbohydrates and zero trans fats.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P7_S0	The Glycemic Index is a measure of the quality of carbohydrates in foods.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P7_S1	Foods on the lower end of the Glycemic Index are generally considered good carbohydrates.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P7_S2	In addition, we continue to offer customers more meal choices, including more than 150 foods with no artificial colors, flavors or sweeteners and more than 120 foods with no artificial preservatives.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P7_S3	All Nutrisystem plans continue to meet the United States Department of Agriculture ( USDA ) guidelines for fat, saturated fat, trans fat, sodium, carbohydrates, fiber, added sugars and protein.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P8_S0	We sell our weight loss programs primarily through a direct-to-consumer sales and distribution approach using the Internet and telephone.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P8_S1	Our customers can place orders 24 hours a day, seven days a week on our websites and the food is shipped directly to our customers doors.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P8_S2	Our customers can either choose our pre-selected favorites food pack or personalize their monthly food orders for their specific tastes or dietary needs.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P8_S3	Our programs do not require customers to visit centers, measure foods or count calories.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P8_S4	The entrees are individually packaged and food preparation time is minimal.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P9_S0	The direct-to-consumer approach using the Internet and telephone provides the convenience and privacy that our customers value.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P9_S1	In addition, we provide online and telephone support to our customers using trained weight loss counselors, registered dietitians, certified diabetes educators and other nutrition and dietary staff, and as a result, our customers do not need to travel for face-to-face meetings.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P10_S0	We believe we are very competitively priced within the weight management industry and provide a compelling value proposition to our customers, which includes a selection of more than 150 menu items, expert guides, tools, including NuMi, and access to nutrition and dietary staff.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P10_S1	We do not charge membership fees.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P10_S2	Various promotional offers and pricing are offered throughout the year.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P11_S0	Competitive Strengths We believe our programs, kits and digital tools offer consumers a sensible approach to losing weight without the use of faddish, unhealthy or unrealistic weight loss methods by educating them about proper portion size, as well as the appropriate combinations of fiber, protein, good carbohydrates and fat.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P11_S1	We intend to capitalize on the following competitive strengths:
1096376_17_ITEM1_P12_S0	We believe most of our customers are very satisfied with our products and believe they have lost weight while using our program.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P12_S1	Our customer research has found that Nutrisystem customers lost an average of 1.0 to 2.0 pounds per week and tended to stay on the program for 11 to 12 weeks.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P13_S0	academic centers , including in patients with Type 2 diabetes.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P13_S1	Studies on our Nu trisystem D Program showed s tatistically significant and clinically meaningful weight loss and improvements in HbA1c (a key measure of blood glucose con trol) were observed, in addition to improvements in secondary endpoints such as waist circumference, total plasma cholesterol and blood pressure.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P14_S0	We believe that our brands are well recognized in the weight management industry.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P14_S1	The Nutrisystem name has been in the weight management industry for more than 40 years, and we estimate that our company and our predecessors have spent hundreds of millions of dollars in advertising over that time period.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P15_S0	Low Cost, Highly Scalable Model .
1096376_17_ITEM1_P16_S0	Unlike traditional commercial weight loss programs, which primarily sell through franchisee and company-owned centers, we primarily generate revenue in our direct channel online and through the telephone (including the redemption of prepaid gift cards).
1096376_17_ITEM1_P16_S1	Our method of distribution removes the fixed costs and capital investment associated with diet centers.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P16_S2	We also minimize fixed costs and capital investments in food procurement and fulfillment: we outsource the production of our food products to a number of vendors and we outsource 100% of our fulfillment operations to a third-party provider.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P17_S0	Our goal is to offer our customers a complete weight loss program that is convenient, private and cost-effective.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P17_S1	Our customers primarily place their orders online or over the telephone and have their food delivered directly to their homes.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P17_S2	This affords our customers the convenience and anonymity that other diets, which rely on weight-loss centers, cannot ensure.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P17_S3	Additionally, we provide our customers with monthly food packages containing a four-week meal plan consisting of breakfasts, lunches, dinners, snacks and flex meal plan recipes, which they supplement with fresh fruits, vegetables, lean protein and low-fat dairy.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P17_S4	This removes the confusion of reading nutrition labels, measuring portions or counting calories, carbohydrates or points.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P18_S0	We believe our weight loss programs offer our customers significant value and are priced below those of our competitors.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P18_S1	In addition, unlike some of our competitors, we do not charge a membership fee.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P19_S0	We also generate revenue through the sale of our multi-day kits and single items at select retail locations.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P19_S1	These multi-day kits and single items have expanded our products and consumer reach.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P19_S2	The retail channel provides us with great brand exposure, offering consumers who may not be aware of our programs an opportunity to sample Nutrisystem at a more attractive price point.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P20_S0	Our Industry Weight management is a challenge for a significant portion of the U.S. population, as well as the global population.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P21_S0	It is estimated that more than one-third (34.9% or 78.6 million) of U.S. adults are obese.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P21_S1	According to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, overweight and obese individuals are increasingly at risk for diseases such as Type 2 diabetes, heart disease, certain types of cancer, stroke, arthritis, sleep apnea and depression.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P21_S2	However, there is evidence that weight loss may reduce the risk of developing these conditions, as well as improve the health and quality of life of people who have these conditions.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P21_S3	Our clinical trial results suggest and analyses of real world customer results confirm that people who stay on the Nutrisystem program for at least three months have a high probability of achieving clinically meaningful weight loss.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P22_S0	In addition to the health risks, there are also cultural implications for those who are overweight or obese.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P22_S1	U.S. consumers are inundated with imagery in media, fashion and entertainment that depicts the thin body as the ideal body type.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P23_S0	Despite the high percentage of overweight and obese individuals in the U.S., the popularity of dieting appears to indicate consumers desire to lose weight.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P23_S1	The weight loss industry is very competitive and consists of pharmaceutical products and weight loss programs, digital tools and wearable trackers, as well as a wide variety of diet foods and meal replacement bars and shakes, appetite suppressants and nutritional supplements.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P23_S2	The weight loss market is served by a diverse array of competitors.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P23_S3	Potential customers seeking to manage their weight can turn to traditional center-based competitors, online diet-oriented sites, self-directed dieting and self-administered products such as prescription drugs, over-the-counter drugs and supplements, meal replacement products, as well as medically supervised programs.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P23_S4	Our identified competitors include, but are not limited to, Weight Watchers International, Inc., Jenny Craig and Medifast, Inc.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P23_S5	We believe that our principal competitive factors in the weight loss market are:
1096376_17_ITEM1_P24_S0	the ability to attract and retain customers through promotion and personal referral.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P25_S0	Based on these factors, we believe that we can compete effectively in the weight loss industry.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P25_S1	We, however, have no control over how successful competitors will be in addressing these factors.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P25_S2	By providing a well-recognized food-based weight management program using the direct channel, we believe that we have a competitive advantage in our market.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P25_S3	Our Products and Services For more than 40 years, the Nutrisystem name has been recognized as a leader in the weight loss industry.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P25_S4	We provide comprehensive weight loss programs, consisting primarily of a pre-packaged food program, digital tools and counseling.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P25_S5	Typically, our customers purchase monthly food packages of frozen and ready-to-go food containing a four-week meal plan consisting of breakfasts, lunches, dinners and snacks and flex meal plan recipes, which they supplement with fresh fruits, vegetables, lean proteins and low-fat dairy.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P25_S6	Most customers order through our Auto-Delivery feature.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P26_S0	Nutrisystem programs feature more than 150 menu options at different price points including frozen and ready-to-go entrees, snacks and shakes.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P26_S1	Trained weight loss counselors are available to answer questions and make recommendations to help each customer achieve and maintain his or her weight loss goal.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P26_S2	Customers support and encourage each other and share information via Nutrisystem social media channels.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P26_S3	These services are complemented with relevant information on diet, nutrition and physical activity, including a personalized My Daily 3 physical activity program and expert guides with tips to help customers succeed on the program.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P26_S4	Additionally, NuMi, our digital product that integrates with wearable fitness devices and health platforms, is offered to our customers free of charge.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P27_S0	Our Nutrisystem program consists of more than 150 foods that contain no artificial colors, flavors or sweeteners and serve as the foundation of a low Glycemic Index diet.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P27_S1	More than 120 foods have no artificial preservatives.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P27_S2	Whole grains were also increased in a large number of our foods to aim to have at least 50% of the grains coming from whole grain sources.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P28_S0	All Nutrisystem plans continue to meet the USDA guidelines for fat, saturated fat, trans fat, sodium, carbohydrates, fiber, added sugars and protein.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P28_S1	We have also worked to reduce the sodium content of our Nutrisystem programs.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P28_S2	Including grocery additions to supplement our meals, all plans contain less than 2,300 milligrams of sodium per day, consistent with national guidelines, and tailored versions of the plans are available that deliver as low as 1,500 mg/day.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P28_S3	In contrast, the average American consumes 2,500-4,600 milligrams of sodium per day.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P29_S0	We constantly strive to meet or exceed nutritional guidelines as they are updated.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P29_S1	In 2016, we offered the Turbo10 program, a clinically tested program that could deliver up to a 10-pound weight loss and a reduction of five inches overall in the first month of dieting.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P30_S0	A large and growing body of scientific evidence suggests a key predictor of long-term weight loss success is quick, early results, which our programs are designed to deliver.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P31_S0	Customers are given a meal plan, access to trackers and tools via NuMi, educational digital content and exercise suggestions.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P31_S1	Customers are also encouraged to check in periodically with a counselor as their needs change in response to weight loss.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P32_S0	Nutrisystem programs deliver a combination of portion-controlled foods and an eating plan based on slow-digesting carbohydrates like fiber, designed to help keep blood sugar levels stable throughout the day, minimizing hunger spikes and the feelings of deprivation that cause cravings.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P32_S1	In December 2016, we announced our multi-brand approach with two new distinct programs, Nutrisystem Lean13 and the all new South Beach Diet .
1096376_17_ITEM1_P33_S0	The Lean13 is designed to deliver weight loss of up to 13 pounds and seven inches in the first month.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P34_S0	South Beach Diet launched in January 2017 as a structured meal delivery weight-loss program.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P34_S1	The plan features fully prepared, globally inspired meals that are flash-frozen to maintain the quality of taste and nutrition, and delivered right to the customer s doorstep.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P35_S0	The South Beach Diet was created by Dr. Arthur Agatston, a cardiologist from southern Florida.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P35_S1	In 2003, he published The South Beach Diet, which became a bestseller with more than 23 million copies in print and multiple titles appearing on the New York Times bestseller list.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P35_S2	Additionally, our multi-day kits are available at select retailers.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P35_S3	We offer several varieties of our Nutrisystem 5-day kit, a D kit targeted to individuals with or at risk of Type 2 diabetes, as well as SmartCarb and PowerFuel products including blueberry muffins, cinnamon buns, vanilla shakes, chocolate shakes and chocolate chip cookie packs, designed to complement our multi-day kits.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P35_S4	The retail channel provides us with great brand exposure, offering consumers who may not be aware of our programs an opportunity to sample Nutrisystem at a more attractive price point.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P35_S5	We are seeing repeat business as well as multiple kit purchases, indicating that customers are seeing results or enlisting other family members to diet with them.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P35_S6	Also, we continue to offer our Nutrisystem programs at Costco through the use of prepaid gift cards.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P35_S7	We are actively developing our retail product pipeline and have multiple kits and single items available for purchase.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P36_S0	For those with Type 2 diabetes or for those at risk for Type 2 diabetes, we have t he Nu trisystem D Program, a weight loss program specifically designed to produce gradual weight loss.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P36_S1	It provides nutrition consistent with the guidelines of the American Diabetes Association.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P37_S0	Two randomized controlled trials pu blished in peer-reviewed medical journals found the Nu trisystem D Program , in combination with counseling sessions, produced statistically and clinically meaningful improvements in weight, HbA1c (a key measure of blood glucose control), and several other risk factors.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P37_S1	Notably, improvements in diabetes control were observed along with a reduction in diabetes medications among participants who received the Nutrisystem D intervention.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P37_S2	A third study, utilizing continuous glucose monitoring technology, found i mprovements in blood glucose control when subjects used the Nu trisystem D Program , even before the achievement of significant weight loss.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S0	By offering a variety of frozen and ready-to-go foods, we help our customers sustain their weight loss efforts.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S1	On our websites, customers can order food 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S2	The transition and maintenance plans allow customers the means to gradually increase their responsibility for grocery shopping and food preparation while adhering to the principles of the approach of our weight loss programs.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S3	These lower cost programs help extend the supportive relationship and allow time to reinforce the dietary changes that produced the initial weight loss.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S4	These plans include recipes and portion-control tools in addition to a reduced number of entrees delivered each month.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S5	Our weight loss programs features are counter to traditional weight loss programs limitations, such as, high initiation and recurring membership fees, the inconvenience of traveling to weight loss centers for scheduled appointments and lack of privacy.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S6	In addition, our prepared meals provide our customers with a structured program with limited weighing and measuring of foods and no need to count calories, carbohydrates or points.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S7	Customers are provided breakfasts, lunches, dinners, snacks and flex meal plan recipes, which they supplement with fresh fruits, vegetables, lean proteins and low-fat dairy.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S8	We believe that the convenience of home delivery, reduced grocery shopping time, the portability of the food, and rapid food preparation also aid customer compliance with our weight loss program.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S9	Our food items have accounted for 99%, 98% and 99% of our revenue for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S10	No other product or service has accounted for more than 1% of our revenue in any of the last three years.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P38_S11	Approximately 99% of our revenue was generated in the United States in each of the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P39_S0	The Customer Experience Our sales, marketing, ecommerce and service operations seek to understand our customers needs throughout their weight loss and management journey to help us develop effective, compelling and innovative products and services.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P39_S1	Through a combination of consumer research and data management, we personalize the introduction, on-boarding, weight loss, transition and maintenance phases of our customers experience.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P40_S0	We attract new customers via direct response television, online marketing (search engine marketing, search engine optimization, affiliate marketing, display advertising, partnerships, retargeting social and email), direct mail, print advertisements and a variety of other direct marketing efforts.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P40_S1	We have a fully integrated acquisition enterprise.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P40_S2	Response is tracked to the specific vehicle, and analytic models are used to attribute other orders back to the response source, in order to closely manage the effectiveness of our specific direct marketing efforts.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P41_S0	The majority of our new customers buy via our websites.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P41_S1	We consistently seek to refine our sales conversion funnel through thoughtful testing to improve the learning and buying experience for prospects and to increase conversion rates.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P41_S2	We also have an in-house call center.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P41_S3	Staffing levels fluctuate seasonally and are aligned to marketing spend and consequent call volume.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P42_S0	Sales agents, paid primarily on commission, take in-bound responses from our advertisements and personalize the weight loss plan for each customer.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P42_S1	They also make out-bound calls to our leads.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P43_S0	To help customers get off to a strong, successful and simple start, we provide both printed materials in initial shipments of food (including Expert Guides, a Quick-Start guide, a Grocery Guide, an Eating Out Guide and a Daily Food Tracker) and a robust set of personalized online tools and trackers.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P44_S0	We use customer preferences to offer a variety of additional products and services that help customers while on the path to their weight loss goals.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P44_S1	These offers are made via our websites, emails, newsletters and our call center.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P44_S2	We also offer counseling services for our customers with trained weight loss counselors, registered dietitians and certified diabetes educators.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P45_S0	Counselors are trained in our programs, motivational techniques and problem solving.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P45_S1	Counselors take in-bound requests for hel p and also reach out to customers via email and phone.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P46_S0	As customers reach their weight loss goals, we offer transition and maintenance programs that provide products and guidance that combine the right amount of structure and flexibility.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P46_S1	These programs are offered online, via email marketing and via our call center s retention agents.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P47_S0	Because we realize that weight management is a lifelong process, and that customers may need our programs again from time to time, we reach out to past customers to attempt to put them back on structured programs if needed.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P47_S1	Our digital content, e-newsletters and the NuMi app help keep customer relationships active after the completion of the first weight loss cycle.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P47_S2	Employing data and segmentation, we develop products and programs that address the varied needs of past customers.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P47_S3	We offer these products and programs via our contact center, television, digital marketing and targeted emails, social media efforts and direct mail.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P48_S0	We are committed to the highest levels of customer service and manage our customer relations through our in-house call center.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P48_S1	Our representatives are trained to answer questions and solve problems once a purchase has been made.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P48_S2	Customers contact us via email, online chat and phone.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P48_S3	Typical inquiries concern delivery dates, reported missing or damaged items, and requests for credits or exchanges.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P49_S0	For email inquiries, we have a software system that scans the customer s email for key words and automatically supplies the representative with a response that is then reviewed, edited and sent to the customer.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P49_S1	We regularly review customer satisfaction levels and improve our practices accordingly.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S0	An integrated order receipt, billing, picking, shipping and delivery tracking system comprised of proprietary and third-party components is utilized for our orders.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S1	This system integrates the front end, or website customer interface, with order processing and shipping, and allows customers to access shippers order tracking numbers online.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S2	Our computer-assisted picking system allows for virtually paperless order picking in all warehouse facilities.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S3	We utilize an integrated network of distribution facilities through an existing arrangement with our outside fulfillment provider.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S4	We work closely with our fulfillment provider to drive out waste and continuously improve processes.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S5	We currently utilize six outsourced distribution facilities.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S6	Three are located in Pennsylvania (Allentown, Bethlehem and Chambersburg), two in Nevada (both in Sparks) and one in Illinois (Troy).
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S7	As of December 31, 2016, all fulfillment was being handled by one outsourced provider.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S8	In April 2017, we expect to have one additional outsourced distribution facility in Lithonia, Georgia with the same provider.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S9	We have a service agreement with our outside fulfillment provider which provides for storage, handling of frozen and ready-to-go foods and other services, including pricing and minimum space commitments.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P50_S10	The current contract expires in 2020 but may be terminated sooner upon 180-day written notice.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P51_S0	We believe that other outside fulfillment providers could be utilized if needed and we continually evaluate the need for secondary fulfillment services.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P51_S1	We continue to partner with our fulfillment provider to reduce the warehouse order turn-around time for processing and shipping orders.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P51_S2	In 2016, approximately, 98% of all customer initial Nutrisystem orders were shipped within 3 business days of the date the order was received.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P51_S3	Direct customers are not charged for their orders until the ordered product is shipped.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P51_S4	We do not charge customers for shipping on any four-week meal plan.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P51_S5	For customers who purchase an Auto-Delivery plan, we provide a discount off the regular one-time rate of the four-week meal plan.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P51_S6	If an Auto-Delivery customer cancels before receipt of a second shipment and after the 14-day money back guarantee period, the customer will be charged a cancellation fee for the Auto-Delivery discount received on the first shipment.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P52_S0	All of our foods and supplements are currently outsourced from more than 35 manufacturers or vendors.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P52_S1	We have entered into supply agreements with several of these food vendors, some of which may provide for annual pricing, annual purchase obligations, exclusivity in the production of certain products, as well as certain rebates to us if certain volume thresholds are exceeded.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P52_S2	These contracts have terms of five years or less and generally may be terminated by us upon written notice, mostly between 30 and 180 days, or under certain circumstances only upon a default of the vendor.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P52_S3	We anticipate meeting all annual purchase obligations.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P53_S0	I n 2016, two vendors each supplied approximately 11% of inventory purchases.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P53_S1	We have a supply agreement with one of these vendors that require s us to make ce rtain minimum purchases.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P53_S2	In 2015 , these vendors supplied approxi mately 19 % and 17 % of inventory purchas es and in 2014, approximately 14% and 17 % of inventory purchases.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P54_S0	Our product development team uses a number of sources customer feedback, market trends, nutrition science, national dietary guidelines and breakthroughs in food technology to create new ideas for our program.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P54_S1	New foods are created to enhance the variety of our current offerings or to support the efforts of creating a new program.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P54_S2	Typically, concepts are formulated in collaboration with our food manufacturers to meet our requirements for nutrition and stability.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P54_S3	We then contract with these food manufacturers to produce these products based on our specifications.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P55_S0	Alternatively, food manufacturers may suggest items.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P55_S1	Regardless of a given food item s pathway through development, that food is evaluated for nutrition, compliance with our program, taste and cost considerations.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P56_S0	The number of stock keeping units, or SKUs, we introduce each year varies depending on whether we are introducing a new program or simply updating an existing one.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P57_S0	We conduct a proactive public relations program that is designed to garner positive coverage of the Company and our weight loss programs across all media platforms including television, magazine, print, online news, bloggers and social media, particularly around the key dieting seasons.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P57_S1	In addition, the public relations team supports an executive communication program to broadly support our brands.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P57_S2	Our Customers We offer weight loss programs designed for women and men as well as people with Type 2 diabetes or at risk for Type 2 diabetes who want to lose weight and manage their diabetes.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P57_S3	Based on our customer research, our typical Nutrisystem customer is female, approximately 45-55 years of age.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P57_S4	We believe that, on average, Nutrisystem customers want to lose more than 40 pounds over a period of time.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P57_S5	Additionally, based on our customer research, we believe our typical Nutrisystem customers tend to stay on our program for 11 to 12 weeks, lose an average of 1.0 to 2.0 pounds per week and have tried other popular diet programs.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P57_S6	We believe that this research indicates our customers value the following Nutrisystem program attributes:
1096376_17_ITEM1_P58_S0	they feel satisfied while on the program.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P59_S0	Our ecommerce and community websites and our tools and trackers, all of which are based primarily on third-party software customized to meet our business needs, are each hosted in top tier hosting facilities.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P59_S1	These facilities provide redundant network connections, physical and fire security and diesel generated power back up for the equipment upon which our websites rely and are intended to provide an uninterruptible power supply.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P59_S2	Our servers and our network are monitored 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P59_S3	We use a variety of security techniques to protect our confidential customer data.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P59_S4	When our customers place an order or access their account information, we secure that transaction by using encryption technologies, including transport layer security, or TLS.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P59_S5	Our customer data is protected against unauthorized access by security measures and we engage a variety of industry leading technology providers including VeriSign, CyberSource and SecureWorks to further ensure the security of our credit card transactions and the safety of our customers personal information.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P59_S6	We own numerous domestic and international trademarks and other proprietary rights that are important to our business.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P60_S0	Depending upon the jurisdiction, trademarks are valid as long as they are used in the regular course of trade and/or their registrations are properly maintained.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P61_S0	We believe the protection of our trademarks, copyrights, patents, domain names, trade dress, and trade secrets is important to our success.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P61_S1	We aggressively protect our intellectual property rights by relying on a combination of watch services and trademark, copyright, patent, trade dress and trade secret laws, and through the domain name dispute resolution system.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P62_S0	Employees As of December 31, 2016, we had 487 employees and consider our relations with these employees to be good.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P63_S0	Typically in the weight loss industry, revenue is greatest in the first calendar quarter and lowest in the fourth quarter.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P64_S0	We believe our business experiences seasonality, driven primarily by the predisposition of dieters to initiate a diet at certain times of the year and the placement of our advertising, which is based on the price and availability of certain media at such times.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P65_S0	Available Information All periodic and current reports, registration statements, code of conduct and other material that we are required to file with the SEC, including our annual report on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form 10-Q, current reports on Form 8-K, and amendments to those reports filed or furnished pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act ), are available free of charge through our investor relations page at www.nutrisystem.com .
1096376_17_ITEM1_P65_S1	Such documents are available as soon as reasonably practicable after electronic filing of the material with the SEC.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P65_S2	Our Internet website and the information contained therein or connected thereto are not intended to be incorporated into this Annual Report.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P65_S3	The public may also read and copy any materials filed by the Company with the SEC at the SEC s Public Reference Room at 100 F Street, NE, Washington, DC 20549.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P65_S4	The public may obtain information on the operation of the Public Reference Room by calling the SEC at 1-800-SEC-0330.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P65_S5	The SEC maintains an Internet site, www.sec.gov , which contains reports, proxy and information statements, and other information regarding issuers that file such information electronically with the SEC.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P66_S0	Executive Officers of the Company The Company s current executive officers and their respective ages and positions are as follows:
1096376_17_ITEM1_P67_S0	Dawn M. Zier has served as our President and Chief Executive Officer and as a member of our Board of Directors since November 2012.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P67_S1	Before joining us, Ms. Zier served as the President of International at The Reader's Digest Association, Inc., a global media and direct marketing company (the Reader's Digest Association ), from April 2011 until November 2012, and as an Executive Vice President of the Reader's Digest Association from February 2011 until November 2012.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P67_S2	From October 2009 to April 2011, Ms. Zier served as President, Europe of the Reader's Digest Association.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P67_S3	Prior to serving in these roles, Ms. Zier served as the President of Global Consumer Marketing for the Reader's Digest Association from June 2008 to October 2009 and as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Direct Holdings U.S. Corp., a marketer of audio and video products and at such time a subsidiary of the Reader's Digest Association, from June 2009 to October 2009.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P68_S0	From August 2005 to June 2008, Ms. Zier served as the President of North American Consumer Marketing for the Reader's Digest Association.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P69_S0	In February 2013, RDA Holdings Co., the holding company and parent of the Reader s Digest Association, filed voluntary petitions for reorganization relief pursuant to Chapter 11 of the United States Bankruptcy Code.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P69_S1	Ms. Zier currently serves on the board of Spirit Airlines, joining in 2015.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P70_S0	Ms. Zier served on the Velo Holdings Inc. Board of Directors from 2015 to 2016, Marketing Edge s Board of Trustees from 2010 to 2012, and the Direct Marketing Association s Board of Directors from 2008 to 2015, while also serving as its Nominating Committee Chair and Secretary from 2012 to 2014.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P70_S1	From 2005 to 2009, she chaired the Magazine s Director s Advisory Committee for the Audit Bureau of Circulations.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P70_S2	Michael P. Monahan has served as our Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer since May 2013.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P70_S3	Prior to joining us, Mr. Monahan served as the Chief Financial Officer of PetroChoice Holdings, Inc., a privately-held distributor of industrial, commercial and passenger car lubricants since January 2009.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P70_S4	From April 2006 through January 2009, Mr. Monahan served as our Vice President of Finance.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P70_S5	Prior to that, Mr. Monahan held positions with Exelon Corporation, Accenture and Arthur Andersen LLP.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P70_S6	Keira Krausz has served as our Executive Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer since February 2013.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P70_S7	Prior to joining us, Ms. Krausz served as head of new business development for Animated Storyboards, a global independent provider of television test spots to the advertising industry, from April 2012 to January 2013.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P70_S8	Prior to that, Ms. Krausz served as Vice President of Marketing for QSP, Inc., a subsidiary of Time, Inc. from 2005 until March 2012 as QSP was sold.
1096376_17_ITEM1_P71_S0	Ass ociation in 1992, and held a number of progressively-responsible positions in product management, marketing, and business management, ultimately ascending to Vice President, Marketing and General Manager, of Reader's Digest Association s Books Music Busi ness.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P0_S0	You should consider carefully the following risks and uncertainties when reading this Annual Report.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P0_S1	If any of the events described below actually occurs, the Company s business, financial condition and operating results could be materially adversely affected.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P0_S2	You should understand that it is not possible to predict or identify all such risks and uncertainties.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P0_S3	Consequently, you should not consider the following to be a complete discussion of all potential risks or uncertainties.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P1_S0	Our future growth and profitability will depend in large part upon the effectiveness and efficiency of our marketing expenditures and our ability to select effective markets and media in which to advertise.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P1_S1	Our marketing expenditures were $152.4 million, $124.2 million and $107.7 million in 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P1_S2	Our future growth and profitability will depend in large part upon the effectiveness and efficiency of our marketing expenditures, including our ability to:
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P2_S0	convert consumer inquiries into actual orders.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P3_S0	Our planned marketing expenditures may not result in increased revenue or generate sufficient levels of brand name and program awareness.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P3_S1	We may not be able to manage our marketing expenditures on a cost-effective basis whereby our customer acquisition costs may exceed the contribution profit generated from each additional customer.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P3_S2	Our sales may be adversely impacted by the health and stability of the general economy.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P3_S3	Unfavorable changes in general economic conditions, such as a recession or prolonged economic slowdown, may reduce the demand for our products and otherwise adversely affect our sales.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P3_S4	For example, economic forces, including general economic conditions, demographic trends, consumer confidence in the economy, changes in disposable consumer income and/or reductions in discretionary spending, may cause consumers to defer purchases of our program which could adversely affect our revenue, gross margins, and/or our overall financial condition and operating results.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P3_S5	We rely on third parties to provide us with adequate food supply, freight and fulfillment and Internet and networking services, the loss of any of which could cause our revenue, earnings or reputation to suffer.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P4_S0	Food Manufacturers and Other Suppliers .
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P4_S1	We rely solely on third-party manufacturers to supply all of the food, other products we sell and packaging materials.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P4_S2	In 2016, two vendors each supplied approximately 11% of inventory purchases.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P5_S0	If we are unable to obtain sufficient quantity, quality and variety of food, other products and packaging materials in a timely and low-cost manner from our manufacturers, we will be unable to fulfill our customers orders in a timely manner, which may cause us to lose revenue and market share or incur higher costs, as well as damage the value of our brands.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P5_S1	In 2016, 100% of our order fulfillment was handled by one third-party provider.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P5_S2	Also, more than 98% of our direct to consumer orders were shipped by one third-party provider and more than 98% of our orders for retail programs were shipped by another third-party provider.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P5_S3	Should these providers be unable to service our needs for even a short duration, our revenue and business could be harmed.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P5_S4	Additionally, the cost and time associated with replacing these providers on short notice would add to our costs.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P5_S5	Any replacement fulfillment provider would also require startup time, which could cause us to lose sales and market share.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P5_S6	Our business also depends on a number of third parties for Internet access and networking, and we have limited control over these third parties.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P5_S7	Should our network connections go down, our ability to fulfill orders would be delayed.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P5_S8	Further, if our websites or call center become unavailable for a noticeable period of time due to Internet or communication failures, our business could be adversely affected, including harm to our brand and loss of sales.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P6_S0	Therefore, w e are dependent on maintaining good relationships with these third parties.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P6_S1	The services we require from these parties may be disrupted by a number of factors associated with their businesses, including the following:
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P7_S0	with respect to our food suppliers, shortages of ingredients or USDA or United States Food and Drug Administration ( FDA ) compliance issues.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S0	We may be subject to claims that our personnel are unqualified to provide proper weight loss advice.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S1	We offer counseling options from weight loss counselors, registered dietitians and certified diabetes educators with varying levels of training.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S2	We may be subject to claims from our customers alleging that our personnel lack the qualifications necessary to provide proper advice regarding weight loss and related topics.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S3	We may also be subject to claims that our personnel have provided inappropriate advice or have inappropriately referred or failed to refer customers to health care providers for matters other than weight loss.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S4	Such claims could result in lawsuits, damage to our reputation and divert management s attention from our business, which would adversely affect our business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S5	We may be subject to health or advertising related claims from our customers.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S6	Our weight loss programs do not include medical treatment or medical advice, and we do not engage physicians or nurses to monitor the progress of our customers.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S7	Many people who are overweight suffer from other physical conditions, and our target consumers could be considered a high-risk population.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S8	A customer who experiences health problems could allege or bring a lawsuit against us on the basis that those problems were caused or worsened by participating in our weight management programs or by consuming one or more of our individual products.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S9	For example, our predecessor businesses suffered substantial losses due to health-related claims and related publicity.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S10	Further, customers who allege that they were deceived by any statements that we made in advertising or labeling could bring a lawsuit against us under consumer protection laws.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S11	Currently, we are neither subject to any such allegations nor have we been named in any such litigation.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S12	If we were subject to any such claims, while we would defend ourselves against such claims, we may ultimately be unsuccessful in our defense.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S13	Also, defending ourselves against such claims, regardless of their merit and ultimate outcome, would likely be lengthy and costly, and adversely affect our results of operations.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P8_S14	Further, our general liability insurance may not cover claims of these types.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P9_S0	The weight management industry is highly competitive.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P9_S1	If any of our competitors or a new entrant into the market with significant resources pursues a weight management program similar to ours, our business could be significantly affected.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P9_S2	Competition is intense in the weight management industry and we must remain competitive in the areas of program efficacy, price, taste, customer service and brand recognition.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P9_S3	Our competitors include companies selling pharmaceutical products and weight loss programs, digital tools and wearable trackers, as well as a wide variety of diet foods and meal replacement bars and shakes, appetite suppressants and nutritional supplements.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P9_S4	Some of our competitors are significantly larger than we are and have substantially greater resources.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P9_S5	Our business could be adversely affected if someone with significant resources decided to imitate our weight management programs.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P9_S6	For example, if a major supplier of pre-packaged foods decided to enter this market and made a substantial investment of resources in advertising and training diet counselors, our business could be significantly affected.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P9_S7	Any increased competition from new entrants into our industry or any increased success by existing competition could result in reductions in our sales or prices, or both, which could have an adverse effect on our business and results of operations.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P10_S0	We are dependent on certain third-party agreements for a percentage of revenue.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P10_S1	We have contractual agreements with certain third-party retailers.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P10_S2	Under the agreements, these third parties control when and how often our products are offered and we are not guaranteed any minimum level of sales.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P10_S3	If any third party elects not to renew their agreement with us or reduces the promotion of our products, our revenue will suffer.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P11_S0	to stop selling our products upon written notice, which may result in an increased level of reclamation claims.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P11_S1	In the event any retailer terminates its relationship with us and the level of reclamation cla ims exceeds the estimated amount reserved on our balance sheet at the time of sale to the retailer, we will have to record an expense for the excess claims, which could adversely impact our results of operations and financial condition.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P11_S2	Additionally, in ce rtain instances, we could be prohibited from selling our products through competitors of these third parties for a specified time after the termination of the agreements.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P12_S0	New weight loss products or services may put us at a competitive disadvantage.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P12_S1	On an ongoing basis, many existing and potential providers of weight loss solutions, including many pharmaceutical firms with significantly greater financial and operating resources than we have, are developing new products and services.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P12_S2	The creation of a weight loss solution, such as a drug therapy, that is perceived to be safe, effective and easier than a portion-controlled meal plan would put us at a disadvantage in the marketplace and our results of operations could be negatively affected.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P12_S3	We may be subject to litigation from our competitors.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P12_S4	Our competitors may pursue litigation against us based on our advertising or other marketing practices regardless of its merit and chances of success, especially if we engage in comparative advertising, which includes advertising that directly or indirectly mentions a competitor or a competitor s weight loss program in comparison to our program.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P12_S5	While we would defend ourselves against any such claims, our defense may ultimately be unsuccessful.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P12_S6	Also, defending against such claims, regardless of their merit and ultimate outcome, may be lengthy and costly, strain our resources and divert management s attention from their core responsibilities, which would have a negative impact on our business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P13_S0	Our business is subject to online security risks, including security breaches and identity theft.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P13_S1	Unauthorized users who penetrate our information security could misappropriate proprietary or customer information or data or cause interruptions to the product offerings on our websites.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P13_S2	As a result, it may become necessary to expend significant additional amounts of capital and resources to protect against, or to alleviate, problems caused by unauthorized users.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P13_S3	These expenditures, however, may not prove to be a timely remedy against unauthorized users who are able to penetrate our information security.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P13_S4	In addition to purposeful security breaches, the inadvertent transmission of computer viruses could adversely affect our computer systems and, in turn, harm our business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P14_S0	A significant number of states require that customers be notified if a security breach results in the disclosure of their personal financial account or other information.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P14_S1	Additional states and governmental entities are considering such notice laws.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P14_S2	In addition, other public disclosure laws may require that material security breaches be reported.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P14_S3	If we experience a security breach and such notice or public disclosure is required in the future, our reputation and our business may be harmed.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S0	In the ordinary course of our business, we collect and utilize proprietary and customer information and data.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S1	Privacy concerns among prospective and existing customers regarding our use of such information or data collected on our websites or through our services and products, such as weight management information, financial data, email addresses and home addresses, could keep them from using our websites or purchasing our services or products.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S2	We currently face certain legal obligations regarding the manner in which we treat such information and data.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S3	Businesses have been criticized by privacy groups and governmental bodies for their use and handling of such information and data.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S4	Currently, a significant number of our customers authorize us to bill their credit cards directly for fees charged by us.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S5	We rely on third-party software products to secure our credit card transactions.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S6	Although we have developed systems and processes that are designed to protect consumer information and prevent fraudulent payment transactions and other security breaches, failure to prevent or mitigate such fraud or breaches or changes in industry standards or regulations may adversely affect our business and operating results or cause us to lose our ability to accept credit cards as a form of payment and result in chargebacks of the fraudulently charged amounts.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S7	Furthermore, widespread credit card fraud may lessen our customers willingness to purchase our products on our websites.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S8	We may experience fluctuations in our operating results which may cause our stock price to be volatile.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S9	We have experienced and expect to continue to experience fluctuations in our quarterly results of operations.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S10	Our business is seasonal, with revenue generally greatest in the first quarter and weakest in the fourth quarter.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S11	The market price of our common stock is subject to fluctuations in response to our operating results, general trends in the weight loss industry, announcements by our competitors, our ability to meet or exceed securities analysts expectations, recommendations by securities analysts, the condition of the financial markets and other factors.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P15_S12	These fluctuations, as well as general economic and market conditions, may adversely affect the market price of our common stock and cause it to fluctuate significantly.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P16_S0	A cquisiti ons and the pursuit of new business opportunities present risks, and we may be unable to achieve the financial and strategic goals of any acquisition or new business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P16_S1	A component of our growth strategy has been and may continue to be to acquire existing businesses or pursue other business opportunities in the market for weight management and fitness products and other complimentary products and services.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P16_S2	These types of transactions will face a number of risks and uncertainties, including:
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P17_S0	the risk that the anticipated benefits of any acquisition or of the commencement of any new business may not be realized, in which event we will not be able to achieve any return on our investment in that new business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P18_S0	Consummating these transactions could also result in the incurrence of additional debt and related interest expense, as well as unforeseen contingent liabilities, all of which could have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition or results of operations.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P18_S1	We may also issue additional equity in connection with these transactions, which would dilute our existing stockholders.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P18_S2	We have and expect to continue to launch new weight loss programs and brands which may not be successful due to the failure of such programs or brands to achieve anticipated levels of market acceptance, which could adversely affect our business, financial condition and results of operations.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P19_S0	There are a number of risks inherent in any new program or brand introduction, which could prevent us from achieving revenue growth and increasing our overall market share in the commercial weight loss market.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P19_S1	Any new program or brand may fail to achieve the anticipated level of market acceptance or appeal to consumer tastes and preferences.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P19_S2	In addition, introduction costs, including product testing and marketing, may be greater than anticipated.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P19_S3	If the new program or brand is not successful or falls short of anticipated market acceptance, we may be adversely affected by continued expenses and the diversion of management time to this initiative.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P19_S4	Any or all of such events could have adverse effects on our business, financial condition and results of operations.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P19_S5	If we do not continue to receive referrals from existing customers, our customer acquisition cost may increase.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P19_S6	We rely on word-of-mouth advertising for a portion of our new customers.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P19_S7	If our brands suffer or the number of customers acquired through referrals drops due to other circumstances, our costs associated with acquiring new customers and generating revenue will increase, which will, in turn, have an adverse effect on our profitability.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P20_S0	We use third-party marketing vendors to promote our products.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P20_S1	If the spokespersons affiliated with the third-party marketing vendors suffer adverse publicity or elect to not renew, our revenue could be adversely affected.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P20_S2	Our marketing strategy depends in part on celebrity spokespersons, as well as customer spokespersons, to promote our weight loss programs.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P20_S3	Any of these spokespersons may become the subject of adverse news reports, negative publicity or otherwise be alienated from a segment of our customer base, whether weight loss related or not.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P20_S4	If so, such events may reduce the effectiveness of his or her endorsement and, in turn, adversely affect our revenue and results of operations.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P20_S5	Additionally, if a spokesperson elects not to renew their agreement with us, our revenue may suffer.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S0	Third parties may infringe on our brand s , trademarks and other intellectual property rights, which may have an adverse impact on our business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S1	We currently rely on a combination of trademark and other intellectual property laws and confidentiality procedures to establish and protect our proprietary rights, including our brands.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S2	If we fail to successfully enforce our intellectual property rights, the value of our brands, services and products could be diminished and our business may suffer.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S3	Our precautions may not prevent misappropriation of our intellectual property.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S4	Any legal action that we may bring to protect our brands and other intellectual property could be unsuccessful and expensive and could divert management s attention from other business concerns.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S5	In addition, legal standards relating to the validity, enforceability and scope of protection of intellectual property, especially in Internet-related businesses, are uncertain and evolving.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S6	We cannot assure you that these evolving legal standards will sufficiently protect our intellectual property rights in the future.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S7	We may in the future be subject to intellectual property rights claims.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S8	Third parties may in the future make claims against us alleging infringement of their intellectual property rights.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S9	Any intellectual property claims, regardless of merit, could be time-consuming and expensive to litigate or settle and could significantly divert management s attention from other business concerns.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S10	In addition, if we were unable to successfully defend against such claims, we may have to pay damages, stop selling the service or product or stop using the software, technology or content found to be in violation of a third party s rights, seek a license for the infringing service, product, software, technology or content or develop alternative non-infringing services, products, software, technology or content.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S11	If we cannot license on reasonable terms, develop alternatives or stop using the service, product, software, technology or content for any infringing aspects of our business, we may be forced to limit our service and product offerings.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P21_S12	Any of these results could reduce our revenue and our ability to compete effectively, increase our costs or harm our business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P22_S0	Our credit agreement contains financial and other covenants.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P22_S1	The failure to comply with such covenants could have an adverse effect on us.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P23_S0	Our credit agreement contains certain financial and other covenants including a minimum consolidated fixed charge coverage ratio (applicable if there are outstanding borrowings), and limitations on, among other things, liens, indebtedness, certain acquisitions, consolidations and sales of assets.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P23_S1	There were no borrowings outstanding as of December 31, 2016.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P24_S0	Any failure to comply with the restrictions of the credit agreement may result in an event of default under the agreement.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P24_S1	We are dependent on our key executive officers for future success.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P24_S2	If we lose the services of any of our key executive officers and we are unable to timely retain a qualified replacement, our business could be harmed.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P24_S3	Our future success depends to a significant degree on the skills, experience and efforts of our key executive officers.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P24_S4	The loss of the services of any of these individuals could harm our business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P24_S5	If any key executive officers left us or were seriously injured and became unable to work, our business could be harmed.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P24_S6	Provisions in our certificate of incorporation may deter or delay an acquisition of us or prevent a change in control, even if an acquisition or a change of control would be beneficial to our stockholders.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P24_S7	Provisions of our certificate of incorporation (as amended) may have the effect of deterring unsolicited takeovers or delaying or preventing a third party from acquiring control of us, even if our stockholders might otherwise receive a premium for their shares over then current market prices.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P24_S8	In addition, these provisions may limit the ability of stockholders to approve transactions that they may deem to be in their best interests.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P25_S0	Our certificate of incorporation (as amended) permits our Board of Directors to issue preferred stock without stockholder approval upon such terms as the Board of Directors may determine.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P25_S1	The rights of the holders of our common stock will be junior to, and may be adversely affected by, the rights of the holders of any preferred stock that may be issued in the future.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P25_S2	The issuance of preferred stock could have the effect of making it more difficult for a third party to acquire, or of discouraging a third party from acquiring, a majority of our outstanding common stock.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P25_S3	The issuance of a substantial number of preferred shares could adversely affect the price of our common stock.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P25_S4	Changes in consumer preferences could negatively impact our operating results.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P25_S5	Our programs feature frozen and ready-to-go food selections, which we believe offer convenience and value to our customers.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P25_S6	Our continued success depends, to a large degree, upon the continued popularity of our programs versus various other weight loss, weight management and fitness regimens, such as low carbohydrate diets, appetite suppressants and diets featured in the published media.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S0	fail ure to provide innovative responses to these changes, may have a materially adverse impact on our business, financia l condition, operating results and cash flows.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S1	Our success is also dependent on our food innovation including maintaining a robust array of food items and improving the quality of existing items.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S2	If we do not continually expand our food items or provide customers with items that are desirable in taste and quality, our business could be harmed.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S3	The weight loss industry is subject to adverse publicity, which could harm our business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S4	The weight loss industry receives adverse publicity from time to time, and the occurrence of such publicity could harm us, even if the adverse publicity is not directly related to us.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S5	In the early 1990s, our predecessor businesses were subject to extremely damaging adverse publicity relating to a large number of lawsuits alleging that the Nutrisystem weight loss program in use at that time led to gall bladder disease.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S6	This publicity was a factor that contributed to the bankruptcy of our predecessor businesses in 1993.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S7	In addition, our predecessor businesses were severely impacted by significant litigation and damaging publicity related to their customers use of fen-phen as an appetite suppressant, which the FDA ordered withdrawn from the market in September 1997.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S8	The significant decline in business resulting from the fen-phen problems caused our predecessor businesses to close all of their company-owned weight loss centers.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S9	Congressional hearings about practices in the weight loss industry have also resulted in adverse publicity and a consequent decline in the revenue of weight loss businesses.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S10	Future research reports or publicity that is perceived as unfavorable or that question certain weight loss programs, products or methods could result in a decline in our revenue.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S11	Because of our dependence on consumer perceptions, adverse publicity associated with illness or other undesirable effects resulting from the consumption of our products or similar products by competitors, whether or not accurate, could also damage customer confidence in our weight loss program and result in a decline in revenue.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P26_S12	Adverse publicity could arise even if the unfavorable effects associated with weight loss products or services resulted from the user s failure to use such products or services appropriately.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P27_S0	Our industry is subject to governmental regulation that could increase in severity and hurt results of operations.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P27_S1	Our industry is subject to federal, state and other governmental regulation.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P27_S2	Certain federal and state agencies, such as the Federal Trade Commission (the FTC ), regulate and enforce such laws relating to advertising, disclosures to consumers, privacy, consumer pricing and billing arrangements and other consumer protection matters.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P28_S0	A determination by a federal or state agency, or a court, that any of our practices do not meet existing or new laws or regulations could result in liability, adverse publicity and restrictions of our business operations.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P29_S0	Some advertising practices in the weight loss industry, in particular, have led to investigations from time to time by the FTC and other governmental agencies and many companies in the weight loss industry, including our predecessor businesses, have entered into consent decrees with the FTC relating to weight loss claims and other advertising practices.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P29_S1	In addition, the FTC s Guides concerning the Use of Endorsements and Testimonials in Advertising require us and other weight loss companies to use a statement as to what the typical weight loss a customer can expect to achieve on our programs when using a customer s weight loss testimonial in advertising.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P30_S0	Federal and state regulation of advertising practices generally, and in the weight loss industry in particular, may increase in scope or severity in the future, which could have a material adverse impact on our business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P30_S1	Other aspects of our industry are also subject to government regulation.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P30_S2	For example, the manufacturing, labeling and distribution of food products, including dietary supplements, are subject to strict USDA and FDA requirements and food manufacturers are subject to rigorous inspection and other requirements of the USDA and FDA, and companies operating in foreign markets must comply with those countries requirements for proper labeling, controls on hygiene, food preparation and other matters.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P30_S3	If federal, state, local or foreign regulation of our industry increases for any reason, then we may be required to incur significant expenses, as well as modify our operations to comply with new regulatory requirements, which could harm our operating results.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P30_S4	Additionally, remedies available in any potential administrative or regulatory actions may include product recalls and requiring us to refund amounts paid by all affected customers or pay other damages, which could be substantial.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P31_S0	Laws and regulations directly applicable to communications, operations or commerce over the Internet such as those governing intellectual property, privacy, libel and taxation, are more prevalent and remain unsettled.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P31_S1	If we are required to comply with new laws or regulations or new interpretations of existing laws or regulations, or if we are unable to comply with these laws, regulations or interpretations, our business could be adversely affected.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P31_S2	Future laws or regulations, including laws or regulations affecting our marketing and advertising practices, relations with consumers, employees, service providers, or our services and products, may have an adverse impact on us.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P32_S0	The sale of ingested products involves product liability and other risks.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P32_S1	Like other distributors of products that are ingested, we face an inherent risk of exposure to product liability claims if the use of our products results in illness or injury.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P32_S2	The foods that we resell in the U.S. are subject to laws and regulations, including those administered by the USDA and FDA that establish manufacturing practices and quality standards for food products.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P32_S3	Product liability claims could have a material adverse effect on our business as existing insurance coverage may not be adequate.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P33_S0	Distributors of weight loss food products, including dietary supplements, as well as our predecessor businesses, have been named as defendants in product liability lawsuits from time to time.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P34_S0	The successful assertion or settlement of an uninsured claim, a significant number of insured claims or a claim exceeding the limits of our insurance coverage would harm us by adding costs to the business and by diverting the attention of senior management from the operation of the business.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P34_S1	We may also be subject to claims that our products contain contaminants, are improperly labeled, include inadequate instructions as to use or inadequate warnings covering interactions with other substances.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P34_S2	Product liability litigation, even if not meritorious, is very expensive and could also entail adverse publicity for us and reduce our revenue.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P34_S3	In addition, the products we distribute, or certain components of those products, may be subject to product recalls or other deficiencies.
1096376_17_ITEM1A_P34_S4	Any negative publicity associated with these actions would adversely affect our brand and may result in decreased product sales and, as a result, lower revenue and profits.
1096376_17_ITEM2_P0_S0	We currently lease one location in Fort Washington, Pennsylvania.
1096376_17_ITEM2_P0_S1	This location totals 119,767 square feet of office space and our lease expires in 2022.
1096376_17_ITEM2_P0_S2	Our fulfillment capacity is located in Chambersburg, Pennsylvania, Allentown, Pennsylvania, Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, Troy, Illinois and Sparks, Nevada through an outsourced provider.
1096376_17_ITEM2_P0_S3	In April 2017, we expect to have one additional outsourced distribution facility located in Lithonia, Georgia with the same provider.
1096376_17_ITEM2_P0_S4	We have no lease obligations to any of our outsourced fulfillment providers; however, we are subject to minimum space commitments which we may reduce over a specified period of time.
1096376_17_ITEM2_P0_S5	Management believes our outsourced fulfillment capacity is adequate to meet our needs for the foreseeable future.
1096376_17_ITEM3_P0_S0	The Company is involved in various claims and routine litigation matters that arise in the ordinary course of business.
1096376_17_ITEM3_P0_S1	In the opinion of management, after consultation with legal counsel, the outcomes of such matters are not anticipated to have a material adverse effect on the Company s consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows in future years and management believes the range of reasonably possible losses from current matters is immaterial.

1096376_17_ITEM5_P2_S0	Prior to 2008, we had not declared or paid any dividend since inception.
1096376_17_ITEM5_P2_S1	We have paid a quarterly dividend of $0.175 per share beginning with the second quarter of 2008.
1096376_17_ITEM5_P2_S2	The declaration and payment of dividends in the future will be determined by our Board of Directors in light of conditions then existing, including our earnings, financial condition, capital requirements and other factors.
