1096376_18_ITEM15_P81_S0	Preferred Stock The Company has authorized 5,000 shares of preferred stock issuable in series upon resolution of the Board of Directors.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P81_S1	Unless otherwise required by law, the Board of Directors can, without stockholder approval, issue preferred stock in the future with voting and conversion rights that could adversely affect the voting power of the common stock.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P82_S0	The issuance of preferred stock may have the effect of delaying, averting or preventing a change in control of the Company.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P83_S0	On December 22, 2017, the U.S. government enacted comprehensive tax legislation commonly referred to as the Tax Cut and Jobs Act (the Tax Act ).
1096376_18_ITEM15_P83_S1	The Tax Act includes a number of changes to existing U.S. tax laws that impact the Company, most notably a reduction of the U.S. corporate income tax rate from 35% to 21% effective January 1, 2018.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P83_S2	Other changes include the acceleration of depreciation for certain assets placed into service after September 27, 2017 as well as, prospective changes beginning in 2018 including additional limitations on executive compensation.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P84_S0	Income tax expense consists of the following:
1096376_18_ITEM15_P85_S0	A reconciliation of the statutory federal income tax rate to the Company s effective tax rate is as follows:
1096376_18_ITEM15_P86_S0	The change in the effective tax rate from 2016 to 2017 was due primarily to the adoption of ASU No. 2016-09 as of January 1, 2017 partially offset by a charge recorded to write-down the net deferred asset due to the enactment of the Tax Act.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P86_S1	The Company recognized an excess tax benefit from share-based compensation of $5,491 in the year ended December 31, 2017 within income tax expense in the accompanying consolidated statement of operations rather than as additional paid-in capital in the accompanying consolidated balance sheet under previous accounting guidance.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P86_S2	This benefit was partially offset by a charge of $836 to write-down the net deferred tax asset to reflect the reduction of the future federal corporate income tax rate from 35% to 21%.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P87_S0	The significant items comprising the Company s deferred income tax assets and liabilities are as follows:
1096376_18_ITEM15_P88_S0	At December 31, 2017 and 2016, the Company had net operating loss carryforwards of approximately $27,948 and $28,038, respectively, for state tax purposes.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P88_S1	For state tax purposes, there is a limitation on the amount of net operating loss carryforwards that can be utilized in a given year to offset state taxable income.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P88_S2	The net operating losses will begin to expire in 2025.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P89_S0	At December 31, 2014, the Company had a valuation allowance of $800 recorded against its deferred tax asset generated for charitable contributions.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P89_S1	The Company recorded the valuation allowance to reduce the deferred tax asset to an amount it expected was more likely than not to be realized due to the short carryforward period for this temporary difference.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P89_S2	In 2015, the Company reduced the valuation allowance to zero due to the expiration of certain charitable contribution carryovers.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P89_S3	At December 31, 2016, there was no valuation allowance.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P89_S4	At December 31, 2017, the Company recorded a valuation allowance of $817 as certain state net operating loss carryforwards might not be realized due to changes in tax legislation.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P89_S5	Based on the projected level of future taxable income over the periods in which the deferred tax assets are deductible, management believes it is more likely than not that the Company will realize the remaining net deferred tax assets.

1096376_18_ITEM15_P91_S0	The total amount of gross unrecognized tax benefits as of December 31, 2017, 2016 and 2015 was $131, $168 and $272, respectively, which is included as a reduction of deferred income taxes in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P91_S1	The total amount of unrecognized tax benefits that, if recognized, would affect the effective income tax rate is approximately $103, $109 and $177 as of December 31, 2017, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P92_S0	The Company records accrued interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits as part of interest (income) expense, net.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P92_S1	No interest expense was recognized during 2017, 2016 and 2015.

1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S0	Equity Incentive Plans The Company has three equity incentive plans: the 1999 Equity Incentive Plan, the 2000 Equity Incentive Plan and the Second Amended and Restated 2008 Long-Term Incentive Plan (collectively, the Equity Incentive Plans ).
1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S1	The Second Amended and Restated 2008 Long-Term Incentive Plan is currently the only plan under which new awards may be granted.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S2	Under that plan, a variety of equity instruments can be granted to key employees and directors including incentive and nonqualified stock options to purchase shares of the Company s common stock, restricted stock, restricted stock units or shares of common stock.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S3	The 1999 Equity Incentive Plan, the 2000 Equity Incentive Plan and the Second Amended and Restated 2008 Long-Term Incentive Plan authorize up to 1,000, 5,600 and 7,400 shares of common stock, respectively, for issuance.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S4	At December 31, 2017, the Second Amended and Restated 2008 Long-Term Incentive Plan had 2,898 shares available for grant.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S5	Under each of the plans, the Board s Compensation Committee determines the term of each award, but no award can be exercisable more than 10 years from the date the award is granted.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S6	The stock options issued under the Equity Incentive Plans generally expire seven years from the grant date.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S7	The Compensation Committee also determines the vesting provisions of all awards and the exercise price per share of stock options issued under the plans, which is the fair value at date of grant.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S8	Awards issued to employees generally vest over terms ranging from two to four years.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P94_S9	The following table summarizes the Company s stock option activity for 2015, 2016 and 2017:

1096376_18_ITEM15_P98_S0	The Company has issued restricted stock to employees generally with vesting terms ranging from two to four years.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P98_S1	The fair value is equal to the market price of th e Company s common stock on the date of grant.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P99_S0	Expense for restricted stock is amortized ratably over the vesting period.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P99_S1	The following table summarizes the restricted stock activity for 2015, 2016 and 2017:
1096376_18_ITEM15_P100_S0	Additionally, the Company grants performance-based restricted stock units.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P100_S1	The performance-based units have performance conditions and service-based vesting conditions.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P100_S2	Each vesting tranche is treated as an individual award and the compensation expense is recognized on a straight-line basis over the requisite service period for each tranche.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P100_S3	The requisite service period is a combination of the performance period and the subsequent vesting period based on continued service.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P100_S4	The level of achievement of such goals may cause the actual amount of units that ultimately vest to range from 0% to 200% of the original units granted.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P101_S0	The Company recognizes expense ratably over the vesting period for performance-based restricted stock units when it is probable that the performance criteria specified will be achieved.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P102_S0	The fair value is equal to the market price of the Company s common stock on the date of grant.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P102_S1	The following table summarizes the restricted stock unit activity for 2015, 2016 and 2017:
1096376_18_ITEM15_P103_S0	The Company recorded compensation expense of $9,319, $5,198 and $4,312 in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations for 2017, 2016 and 2015, respectively, in connection with the issuance of restricted stock and restricted stock units.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P103_S1	As of December 31, 2017, the Company expects 228 shares of restricted stock and 227 restricted stock units to vest.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P104_S0	As of December 31, 2017, there was $7,664 of total unrecognized compensation expense related to unvested share-based compensatio n arrangements, which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 1 year.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P104_S1	The total unrecognized compensation expense will be fully charged to expense through the first quarter of 2020.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P105_S0	The Company maintains a qualified tax deferred defined contribution retirement plan (the Plan ).
1096376_18_ITEM15_P105_S1	Under the provisions of the Plan, substantially all employees meeting minimum age and service requirements are entitled to contribute on a before and after-tax basis a certain percentage of their compensation.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P105_S2	The Company matched 100% of employees first 3% contribution and 50% of the employees next 2% contribution.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P105_S3	Employees vest immediately in their contributions and the Company s contribution.
1096376_18_ITEM15_P105_S4	The Company s contributions in 2017, 2016 and 2015 were $965, $892 and $794, respectively.

1096376_18_ITEM15_P161_S0	Exhibit 32.1 Statement of Chief Executive Officer Pursuant to Section 1350 of Title 18 of the United States Code Pursuant to Section 1350 of Title 18 of the United States Code as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the undersigned, Dawn M. Zier, the Chief Executive Officer of Nutrisystem, Inc. (the Company ), hereby certifies that based on the undersigned s knowledge:
1096376_18_ITEM15_P162_S0	The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
